original: @213b ` // lta ba'i khyad par bzhugs /
analyzed: @213b ` // lta ba'i khyad par bzhugs /
translated: The Distinctions of Views

original: # // phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i lta ba'i bye brag dang / theg pa gsum dang sku gsum la sogs pa mkhan po dag las thos pa dang / gsung rab mdo sde dang / bstan bcos las byung ba'i don mdo tsam zhig brjed byang du byas pa /
analyzed: # // phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i lta ba'i bye brag dang / theg pa gsum dang sku gsum la sogs pa mkhan po dag las thos pa dang / gsung rab mdo sde dang / bstan bcos las byung ba'i don mdo tsam zhig brjed byang du byas pa /
translated: I have written this memorandum on the meaning of the scriptures, sutras, and treatises, which I have heard from my masters, such as the distinctions of views of those who propound the existence of external objects, the three vehicles, the three bodies of a buddha, and so on.

original: a'a ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu nas dbu ma'i k'a ram k'a mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba dang / dbu ma'i snying po zhes bya ba mdzad pa dang / bar gyi mkhan po sh'anta rakshi ta zhes bya bas a'ats'arya aa sam gas rnam par shes pa tsam du bshad pa'i bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa mdzad pa la brten te /
analyzed: a'a ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu nas dbu ma'i k'a ram k'a mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba dang / dbu ma'i snying po zhes bya ba mdzad pa dang / bar gyi mkhan po sh'anta rakshi ta zhes bya bas a'ats'arya aa sam gas rnam par shes pa tsam du bshad pa'i bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa mdzad pa la brten te /
translated: The master Nagarjuna composed the commentary called the Lamp of Wisdom and the Essence of the Middle Way, and the intermediate master Santaraksita, who composed the treatise Yogacarya that explains the position of Asanga that everything is mere consciousness.

original: kun rdzob tu de'i lugs dang mthun par rnam par shes pa tsam du bsgrubs la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de'i lugs dang mthun par rnam par shes pa tsam du bsgrubs la /
translated: In accordance with his system, I have established that conventionally everything is mere consciousness.

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin med par bshad pa'i dbu ma'i bstan bcos dbu ma'i rgyan zhes bya ba zhig mdzad de /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin med par bshad pa'i dbu ma'i bstan bcos dbu ma'i rgyan zhes bya ba zhig mdzad de /
translated: He composed a treatise on the middle way called Ornament of the Middle Way, which explains that ultimately consciousness also lacks intrinsic existence.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos lugs cung zad mi mthun pa gnyis byung bas /
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos lugs cung zad mi mthun pa gnyis byung bas /
translated: Thus two slightly different systems of Madhyamaka treatises arose.

original: a'a ts'arya bha byas mdzad pa la ni mdo sde ba'i dbu ma zhes btags /
analyzed: a'a ts'arya bha byas mdzad pa la ni mdo sde ba'i dbu ma zhes btags /
translated: The one composed by Ācārya Bhāviveka is called Sautrāntika Madhyamaka.

original: a'a ts'arya sh'anta rakshi tas mdzad pa la ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma zhes btags so //
analyzed: a'a ts'arya sh'anta rakshi tas mdzad pa la ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma zhes btags so //
translated: The one composed by Ācārya Śāntarakṣita is called Yogācāra Madhyamaka.

original: a'a ts'arya n' g'a rdzun dang ; a'a rya de was mdzad pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: a'a ts'arya n' g'a rdzun dang ; a'a rya de was mdzad pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: The one composed by Ācārya Nāgārjuna and Ārya Deva is in accordance with what appears in the noble Perfection of Wisdom sūtras and so on.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs la ri bong gi rva bzhin du med la /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs la ri bong gi rva bzhin du med la /
translated: If form and so on do not exist like the horns of a rabbit,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin na ni 'di dag thog ma med pa nyid nas med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin na ni 'di dag thog ma med pa nyid nas med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: and consciousness itself appears in that way, then since beginningless time they have been nonexistent.

original: gzugs su 'khrul pa'i gzhi mad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs su 'khrul pa'i gzhi mad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the basis of the error of form does not exist,

original: de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa de ltar snang ba zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa de ltar snang ba zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to say that consciousness appears in that way.

original: yang gcig tu na gzhi med par sems nyid de ltar snang na ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //🔽ci ste yul med pa'i gtan tshigs su dngos pa rags pa rdul du bshig la /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na gzhi med par sems nyid de ltar snang na ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so // ci ste yul med pa'i gtan tshigs su dngos pa rags pa rdul du bshig la /
translated: Moreover, if the mind itself appears in that way without a basis, it would be logical that even the horns of a rabbit, the son of a barren woman, and so on would appear.

original: rdul yang phyogs cha yod de mi 'grub pas sems tsam mo zhes bya na ni /
analyzed: rdul yang phyogs cha yod de mi 'grub pas sems tsam mo zhes bya na ni /
translated: If you say that because coarse things are destroyed by the particles and the particles are not established as having directional parts, therefore it is mind only,

original: 'o na lta rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma yang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pas yul yod do //
analyzed: 'o na lta rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma yang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad pas yul yod do //
translated: then, in that case, because the general characteristics of the moments of consciousness are explained, the object exists.

original: spyir dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: spyir dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pas /
translated: In general, because things are dependently arisen,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba tsam du skye ba yod @214a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba tsam du skye ba yod @214a * //
translated: in the relative they arise merely like an illusion.

original: la ; don dam par ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang / rgyu med pa las kyang skyer mi rung ste /
analyzed: la ; don dam par ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang / rgyu med pa las kyang skyer mi rung ste /
translated: In the ultimate, they are not suitable to arise from self, other, both, or causelessly.

original: rang bzhin med do zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin med do zhes bshad pas /
translated: Since it is explained that they are essenceless,

original: dbu ma pa gnyi ga yang de la brten to //
analyzed: dbu ma pa gnyi ga yang de la brten to //
translated: Both Madhyamaka systems are based on that.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i lugs ni kun rdzob tu ni rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dang mthun te /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dbu ma'i lugs ni kun rdzob tu ni rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dang mthun te /
translated: The Madhyamaka system of Yogācāra is in accord with the Proponents of Consciousness in terms of the relative.

original: rnam par shes pas yul shes pa yang yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas yul shes pa yang yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Consciousness is aware of objects, and objects are the nature of consciousness.

original: 'brel ba yod pa'i phyir rang rig pas shes par rung gi yul gzhan yin par 'dod na ni shes pa dang 'brel pa med pas rig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'brel ba yod pa'i phyir rang rig pas shes par rung gi yul gzhan yin par 'dod na ni shes pa dang 'brel pa med pas rig par mi rung ngo //
translated: Because they are related, it is suitable for consciousness to be aware of itself. If objects were asserted to be different from consciousness, they would not be related to consciousness, and therefore it would be unsuitable for them to be known.

original: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar snang bar snang ba yang dper na rmi lam na mthong ba rnams yul med kyi sems nyid mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar snang bar snang ba yang dper na rmi lam na mthong ba rnams yul med kyi sems nyid mthong ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: The appearance of external dependent arising is like what is seen in a dream, where there are no objects, but mind itself is seen.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra says:

original: phyi rol gzugs ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gzugs ni yod ma yin //
translated: External forms do not exist.

original: bdag gi sems ni phyi rol snang //
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni phyi rol snang //
translated: My mind appears as external.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: don dam par ni sems de yang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bshig na yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni sems de yang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bshig na yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, that mind is not established as existent when it is destroyed by the argument of the absence of identity and difference.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the object is the nature of consciousness,

original: yang na ni yul tha dad pa rnam pa mang po bzhin du sems kyang du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yul tha dad pa rnam pa mang po bzhin du sems kyang du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like the many different objects, the mind would be multiple.

original: yang na ni sems bzhin du yul yang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni sems bzhin du yul yang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, like the mind, the object would not be various.

original: de lta bas na sems tsam la brten nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems tsam la brten nas /
translated: Therefore, based on mind only,

original: phyi rol gyi yul med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that external objects do not exist.

original: dbu ma'i tshul 'di la brten nas sems de yang bdag med par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dbu ma'i tshul 'di la brten nas sems de yang bdag med par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Based on this Madhyamaka method, one should understand that mind also is without self.

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: The noble Transcendent Wisdom states,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum ni sems tsam ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum ni sems tsam ste /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious One, the three realms are mind only.

original: dus gsum yang sems tsam du rtogs shing /
analyzed: dus gsum yang sems tsam du rtogs shing /
translated: The three times are also understood as mind only.

original: sems de yang mtha' dang dbus med par rtogs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems de yang mtha' dang dbus med par rtogs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: And that mind is understood to be without end or middle.”

original: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: The Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra also says:

original: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
translated: Relying on mind alone,

original: phyi rol don la mi brtag go //
analyzed: phyi rol don la mi brtag go //
translated: Do not imagine external objects.

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas su //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas su //
translated: Likewise, having abided in reality,

original: sems tsam las kyang bzla bar bya ;
analyzed: sems tsam las kyang bzla bar bya ;
translated: One should transcend mind only.

original: / sems tsam las ni bzlas nas su //
analyzed: / sems tsam las ni bzlas nas su //
translated: Having transcended mind only,

original: snang ba med las bzla bar bya //
analyzed: snang ba med las bzla bar bya //
translated: One should transcend the absence of appearances.

original: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who abides in the absence of appearances

original: de yis theg pa chen po mthong //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yis theg pa chen po mthong // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Will see the Great Vehicle.

original: de lta bas na dbu ma'i tshul 'di don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbu ma'i tshul 'di don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because this Madhyamaka system would be faulty in that it would be pointless.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po skye ba mi 'thad @214b pa de'i phyir skye ba mi srid de /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po skye ba mi 'thad @214b pa de'i phyir skye ba mi srid de /
translated: Thus, because the arising of things is untenable, therefore arising is impossible.

original: skye ba brjod pa ni tha dad btags pa tsam du zad do //🔽rnam par shes pa tsam du smras pas phyi rol gyi yul med kyi /
analyzed: skye ba brjod pa ni tha dad btags pa tsam du zad do // rnam par shes pa tsam du smras pas phyi rol gyi yul med kyi /
translated: The expression “arising” is just a superimposition of difference.

original: sems nyid don du snang zhes bya ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: sems nyid don du snang zhes bya ba yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that because it is said that consciousness is only, external objects do not exist and that mind itself appears as objects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: yul nyid rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Since the object itself has the nature of consciousness,

original: yul yang shes pa can du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: yul yang shes pa can du 'gyur ro ;
translated: the object would also be conscious.

original: / yang na ni shes pa nyid gzugs yin pas sems kyang shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / yang na ni shes pa nyid gzugs yin pas sems kyang shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, since consciousness itself is form, the mind would be without consciousness.

original: yang na ni yul rnam pa mang po sna tshogs yod pa bzhin du smes kyang sna tshogs du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yul rnam pa mang po sna tshogs yod pa bzhin du smes kyang sna tshogs du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, just as the many different kinds of objects exist, the mind would also be multiple and various.

original: yang na ni sems bzhin du yul yang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni sems bzhin du yul yang sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, just as the mind is, the object would not be various and multiple.

original: yang na ni sems kyang gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni sems kyang gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, the mind would also have form.

original: yang na ni gzugs kyang sems bzhin du bltar mi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽rnam pa gcig tu na yul med kyi /
analyzed: yang na ni gzugs kyang sems bzhin du bltar mi snang bar 'gyur ro // rnam pa gcig tu na yul med kyi /
translated: Or, just as the mind is, form would not appear to the sight.

original: sems nyid yul du snang na ni gzugs dang kha dog gi rnam pa ji lta bu bsams pa dang / ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad yul nyid du 'byung zhing snang ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: sems nyid yul du snang na ni gzugs dang kha dog gi rnam pa ji lta bu bsams pa dang / ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du thams cad yul nyid du 'byung zhing snang ba'i rigs so //
translated: In one way, if the mind itself appears as the object without an external object, it is reasonable that whatever form and color it imagines and whatever it desires would all appear as the object.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na gzugs rdul du bshig ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na gzugs rdul du bshig ste /
translated: Or, in another way, if form is destroyed into particles,

original: rdul phra rab kyang cha shas kyis bshig na med pa bzhin du sems kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyang cha shas kyis bshig na med pa bzhin du sems kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: And just as the atom is destroyed by being divided into parts, so the mind would be destroyed.

original: de ltar sems nyid yul du snang zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems nyid yul du snang zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not correct to say that the mind itself appears as objects.

original: thog ma med pa nas gzugs su rtog pa'i bag chags smin pas /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas gzugs su rtog pa'i bag chags smin pas /
translated: Since beginningless time, the ripening of the habitual tendencies of conceptualizing form🔽causes such appearances to occur.

original: de ltar snang ngo zhes byar yang yul yang med na de ltar rtog pa mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: de ltar snang ngo zhes byar yang yul yang med na de ltar rtog pa mi 'byung bas /
translated: If there were no objects, such conceptualization would not occur.

original: de'i bag chags kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bag chags kyang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those habitual tendencies would not exist.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Ten Stages says,🔽“The three realms are mind only.”

original: khams gsum pa sems tsam mo zhes 'byung ba ni byed pa po dang za ba po dgag pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa sems tsam mo zhes 'byung ba ni byed pa po dang za ba po dgag pa ste /
translated: This is a refutation of the creator and the experiencer.

original: mdo sde de nyid las /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid las /
translated: The same sūtra says,

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur rab tu rtogs shing bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyi byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur rab tu rtogs shing bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyi byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe /
translated: “Thus, when one realizes dependent origination in ten ways, and realizes selflessness, the absence of a life-force, the absence of a person, emptiness by nature, the absence of an inherently existent creator, and the absence of an inherently existent experiencer,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the door of liberation of emptiness has arisen.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa las /🔽phyi rol gyi don med kyi sems de ltar snang ngo zhes 'byung ba yang dngos po don dam par yod par 'dod pa dgag pa dang / sems tsam du bshad pas 'dul ba la phan gdags pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don rang bzhin gyis dngos por grub @215a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa las / phyi rol gyi don med kyi sems de ltar snang ngo zhes 'byung ba yang dngos po don dam par yod par 'dod pa dgag pa dang / sems tsam du bshad pas 'dul ba la phan gdags pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don rang bzhin gyis dngos por grub @215a * //
translated: The noble Descent into Lanka and so on state:🔽“External objects do not exist; the mind appears as such.”🔽This is stated with the intention that things ultimately exist, in order to refute the assertion that things do not exist and in order to benefit those to be tamed by the explanation of mind only.

original: pa med pa la log pa'i rnam par rtog pas dngos por sgro btags pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: pa med pa la log pa'i rnam par rtog pas dngos por sgro btags pa la dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: The meaning of dependent arising is that things do not inherently exist, but due to distorted conception, things are exaggerated to exist.

original: a'arya ts'arya ka ma la sh'i las dbu ma'i bstan bcos dbu ma snang ba zhes bya ba mdzad pa las ni dbu ma 'di gnyis kun rdzob tu cung zad mi mthun yang /
analyzed: a'arya ts'arya ka ma la sh'i las dbu ma'i bstan bcos dbu ma snang ba zhes bya ba mdzad pa las ni dbu ma 'di gnyis kun rdzob tu cung zad mi mthun yang /
translated: The author of the Madhyamaka treatise Madhyamakāloka, the noble master Kamalaśīla, explains that these two Madhyamaka are slightly different in the conventional but are the same in the ultimate.

original: don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par 'dod du 'dra bas na 'gal ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don dam par phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par 'dod du 'dra bas na 'gal ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since they are similar in asserting that ultimately all outer and inner things lack intrinsic existence, there is no contradiction.

original: theg pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The three vehicles are the śrāvaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the Mahayana.

original: theg pa zhes bya ba ni bzhon pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba ni bzhon pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: A vehicle is like a mount.

original: des theg cing so so'i gnas su son par byed pas theg pa'o //
analyzed: des theg cing so so'i gnas su son par byed pas theg pa'o //
translated: It is a vehicle because it conveys one to one’s destination.

original: zam pa dang gru dang gzings dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zam pa dang gru dang gzings dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is also a vehicle because it is like a bridge, a boat, or a raft,

original: des bteg cing brten nas 'khor ba'i chu bo'i pha rol tu phyin pas na yang theg pa'o //
analyzed: des bteg cing brten nas 'khor ba'i chu bo'i pha rol tu phyin pas na yang theg pa'o //
translated: because it conveys one and supports one to the other side of the river of saṃsāra.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa ni bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa ni bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug ste /
translated: The śrāvaka vehicle enters through the four truths.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi gzhi yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi gzhi yin pas /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates, which are contaminated results, are the basis of various sufferings,

original: blta sla ba'i phyir thog mar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs so //
analyzed: blta sla ba'i phyir thog mar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs so //
translated: and because they are easy to see, one first realizes the truth of suffering.

original: de nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtags na las dang nyon mongs pa las byung bar rigs te /
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brtags na las dang nyon mongs pa las byung bar rigs te /
translated: Then, when the cause of suffering is investigated, it is logical that it arises from karma and afflictions.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rtogs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rtogs so //
translated: Thus, the truth of origination is realized.

original: de nas las dang nyon mongs pa spangs te ;
analyzed: de nas las dang nyon mongs pa spangs te ;
translated: Then, having abandoned karma and afflictions,

original: phung po lnga dang bral ba ni bden pa yin par rig ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang bral ba ni bden pa yin par rig ste /
translated: one should know that freedom from the five aggregates is the truth.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa rtogs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa rtogs so //
translated: Thus, the truth of cessation is realized.

original: de nas 'gog pa thob par bya ba'i thabs ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yin par rig ste /
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa thob par bya ba'i thabs ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yin par rig ste /
translated: Then, the method for attaining cessation is the noble path of right view and so on.

original: lam gyi bden pa rtogs so //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa rtogs so //
translated: Thus, the truth of the path is realized.

original: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad de /
translated: Thus, contaminated and uncontaminated states are merely cause and effect.

original: byed pa po dang za ba po bdag med par mthong bas /
analyzed: byed pa po dang za ba po bdag med par mthong bas /
translated: Since one sees that there is no self as an agent or experiencer,

original: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs so //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs so //
translated: one realizes the selflessness of persons.

original: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal mi bzad pa yin zhing //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal mi bzad pa yin zhing //
translated: Samsara is unbearable suffering,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba dang bde bar rig la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba dang bde bar rig la /
translated: and nirvana is known to be peace and bliss.

original: de gnyis las gcig spang zhing gcig thob par bya bar rung bar rtogs pas /
analyzed: de gnyis las gcig spang zhing gcig thob par bya bar rung bar rtogs pas /
translated: Therefore, they understand that it is possible to abandon one of those two and to obtain the other.

original: sdug bsngal gyis khong dngangs shing mi bzod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis khong dngangs shing mi bzod de /
translated: They are frightened and distressed by suffering.

original: 'khor bas skyo zhing yid byung ba dang / snying rje shin tu chung ste /
analyzed: 'khor bas skyo zhing yid byung ba dang / snying rje shin tu chung ste /
translated: They are disenchanted with and distressed by cyclic existence, and their compassion is very weak.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod pa yang sems can mang po'i don gyi phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod pa yang sems can mang po'i don gyi phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: They practice virtue, such as the perfections, not for the sake of many sentient beings.🔽They practice for their own benefit alone and they seek the happiness of nirvana for themselves.

original: bdag gcig pu'i don du spyod cing @215b bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i dus na yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma ltos par bdag nyid kyis bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu'i don du spyod cing @215b bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bsgrub pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i dus na yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ma ltos par bdag nyid kyis bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: Even when they attain realization, they cannot realize the reality of the four noble truths by themselves without relying on a spiritual master.

original: dbang po rtul bas theg pa dman pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul bas theg pa dman pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called disciples of duller acumen because they are of duller acumen than the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nyan cing gzhan la yang sgrogs te thos par bya bas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nyan cing gzhan la yang sgrogs te thos par bya bas na nyan thos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called disciples because they listen to spiritual masters and proclaim to others what they have heard.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i sgo nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i sgo nas 'jug ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddha vehicle is entered by way of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs rga shi mthong nas ci las byung zhes brtags nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs rga shi mthong nas ci las byung zhes brtags nas /
translated: Having seen the faults of cyclic existence, such as aging and death, one analyzes, “From what do these arise?”

original: de'i rgyu skye ba yin par rig la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu skye ba yin par rig la /
translated: One understands that their cause is birth.

original: de bzhin du brtsad na gong nas gong du ma rig pa la thug gi bar du /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtsad na gong nas gong du ma rig pa la thug gi bar du /
translated: Similarly, if one analyzes further, one will understand that ignorance is the ultimate source.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du rtogs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du rtogs nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung tsam du zad de /
translated: Having understood this in terms of cause and effect, one will understand that dependent origination is merely the arising of one thing from another.

original: bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba med pas gang zag la bdag med par mthong zhing /🔽snga phyi cha shas kyis bshig na yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba med pas gang zag la bdag med par mthong zhing / snga phyi cha shas kyis bshig na yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since there is no self or entity connected to the self, one will see that there is no self in the person.

original: mthun par skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: mthun par skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: If one analyzes by breaking down the person into earlier and later parts, one will not find anything that exists.

original: yul med la sems yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: yul med la sems yod par mi rung ste /
translated: Since this is the case, it is not suitable to say that the mind exists without an object.

original: de gnyis ni gyi na tha snyad btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: de gnyis ni gyi na tha snyad btags par zad kyi /
translated: These two are merely imputed in terms of conventional expressions.

original: dngos su ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: In actuality, it is not like that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Transcendent Conqueror also said:

original: phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba phye ste gsungs pas sems dang yul gnyi ga don dam par yod par mngon no //
analyzed: phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba phye ste gsungs pas sems dang yul gnyi ga don dam par yod par mngon no //
translated: Since the Buddha taught external dependent arising and internal dependent arising separately, it is clear that both mind and objects exist ultimately.

original: mdo dag las /
analyzed: mdo dag las /
translated: The sūtras say,🔽“The mind itself, which is without an object, appears as an object.”

original: yul med kyi sems nyid yul du snang ngo zhes 'byung ba ni yul rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa ma yin gyi dngos po mi rtag pa dang / rdul mang po 'dus pa la 'khrul pa'i rtog pas brtags pa dang / ril bor 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: yul med kyi sems nyid yul du snang ngo zhes 'byung ba ni yul rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa ma yin gyi dngos po mi rtag pa dang / rdul mang po 'dus pa la 'khrul pa'i rtog pas brtags pa dang / ril bor 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: This does not refute objects in every way but is taught as an antidote to the conception of things that are impermanent and composed of many particles as permanent and unitary, respectively.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don med kyi rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang du zad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don med kyi rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang du zad de /
translated: Proponents of consciousness only say that external objects such as form do not exist and that consciousness itself appears as those objects.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa dang / bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bdag tu brjod pa sna tshogs dang / chos sna tshogs nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa dang / bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bdag tu brjod pa sna tshogs dang / chos sna tshogs nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa yin te /
translated: The various expressions of self that occur in the world and in the treatises, and the various designations of phenomena, occur due to the transformation of consciousness.

original: de dag dngos su yod pa la 'dogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag dngos su yod pa la 'dogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not designations of what actually exists.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod @216a * //🔽par bltas pas /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod @216a * // par bltas pas /
translated: Since beginningless time, the habitual tendencies of the conceptualization of self and so on and of phenomena such as form exist in the foundation consciousness.🔽Therefore, it is thought that the appearance of self and phenomena occurs from that foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de las bdag dang chos su snang ngo snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'byung bas yul med do //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de las bdag dang chos su snang ngo snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'byung bas yul med do //
translated: Since conceptualization occurs, there is no object.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dngos po gong bur snang ba ni rdul phra mo 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po gong bur snang ba ni rdul phra mo 'dus pa yin la /
translated: The appearance of a mass of things is a collection of subtle particles.

original: gong bur rtsom pa'i rdul phra mo ni phyogs drug gi cha yod pas /
analyzed: gong bur rtsom pa'i rdul phra mo ni phyogs drug gi cha yod pas /
translated: Since the subtle particles that compose the mass have six parts,

original: rdul phra mor 'grub pa'i phyir yul med par mngon te /
analyzed: rdul phra mor 'grub pa'i phyir yul med par mngon te /
translated: it is evident that there is no object because the subtle particle is not established.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis nam mkha' la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis nam mkha' la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong bzhin no //
translated: It is like, for example, the seeing of a mass of hair and so on in the sky by one who has an eye disease.🔽The Dashabhumika Sutra also says:

original: sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes 'byung /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes 'byung /
translated: O son of the Conqueror, this triple world is mind only.

original: stug po bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: stug po bkod pa las kyang /
translated: The Ghanavyuha Sutra also says:

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis dngos su //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis dngos su //
translated: The mind is actually twofold:

original: gzung dang 'dzin par snang ba ste /🔽bum pa snam bu la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin par snang ba ste / bum pa snam bu la sogs pa'i //
translated: It appears as the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: yul ni gang yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: yul ni gang yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no object whatsoever,🔽Such as a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: zhes gsungs / lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs / lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The Lankaavatara Sutra says:

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even though external entities do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears as the twofold representation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phyi'i don yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: phyi'i don yod pa ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa nyid de ltar snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, external objects do not exist, but consciousness itself appears in that way.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is dependently arisen.

original: rgyun gyi rtag pa yin pas don dam par yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyun gyi rtag pa yin pas don dam par yang yod de /
translated: Since it is permanent in the sense of being a continuum, it exists ultimately.

original: gnas gyur pa'i dus na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa yod do zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i dus na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang las dben pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa yod do zhes 'chad do //
translated: And when the transformation of the basis occurs, the nondual pristine wisdom that is free from the apprehended, the apprehender, and action is fully present without error.

original: dbu ma rnam gnyis kyi tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dbu ma rnam gnyis kyi tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the system of the two Centrists?

original: sngon gyi dbu ma'i mkhan po a' ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu na dang / a'arya de was dbu ma'i bstan bcos mdzad par zad de /
analyzed: sngon gyi dbu ma'i mkhan po a' ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu na dang / a'arya de was dbu ma'i bstan bcos mdzad par zad de /
translated: The former Centrist masters, Acarya Nagarjuna and Aryadeva, composed treatises on the Centrist system.

original: rnam pa gnyis su phye ba yang med /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su phye ba yang med /
translated: There was no division into two.

original: de'i 'og tu a'a ts'arya aa sam ga dang / ba su ban dhus rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i bstan bcos mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu a'a ts'arya aa sam ga dang / ba su ban dhus rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i bstan bcos mdzad de /
translated: Later, Acarya Asanga and Vasubandhu composed treatises on the system of Mind Only,

original: phyi rol gyi yul med kyi rnam par shes pa nyid yul du snang bar bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med kyi rnam par shes pa nyid yul du snang bar bsgrubs shing /
translated: proving that external objects do not exist and that consciousness itself appears as objects.

original: rnam par shes pa dag pa gnyis su med pa ni don dam par yang yod par bshad pa la phyis dbu ma'i mkhan po bha bya zhes bya ba a'a ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu na'i lus kyi man ngag yod pas dngos grub brnyes pa zhig bzhugs pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dag pa gnyis su med pa ni don dam par yang yod par bshad pa la phyis dbu ma'i mkhan po bha bya zhes bya ba a'a ts'arya n'a g'a rdzu na'i lus kyi man ngag yod pas dngos grub brnyes pa zhig bzhugs pas /
translated: The master of the Madhyamaka, Bhavya, who was an ācārya who possessed the esoteric instructions of Nāgārjuna’s body and had attained spiritual powers, later refuted the explanation that the pure consciousness that is nondual exists even in the ultimate.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba sun phyung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba sun phyung ste /
translated: He refuted the proponents of consciousness only.

original: theg pa chung ngu ba phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de las gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu ba phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba ni phyi rol gyi don bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de las gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The proponents of the Hīnayāna who propound the existence of external objects say that external objects are the four great elements and the forms and so on that are derived from them.

original: de dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad @216b mas kyang yod par grub la /
analyzed: de dag ni mngon sum gyi tshad @216b mas kyang yod par grub la /
translated: They say that they are established as existing by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: phung po lnga las kyang gzugs kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched las kyang dbang po gzugs can dang / de dag gi yul rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga las kyang gzugs kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched las kyang dbang po gzugs can dang / de dag gi yul rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / de las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The form aggregate, the physical faculties, and their objects are the four great elements and what are derived from them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yod do zhes gsungs shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yod do zhes gsungs shing /
translated: The Bhagavān also taught that the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres exist.

original: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i rang dang ma rig pa ni dgag tu rung la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i rang dang ma rig pa ni dgag tu rung la /
translated: He refuted the great elements and so on, and he refuted ignorance.

original: de 'gags na rga shi'i bar du 'gags par mthong /
analyzed: de 'gags na rga shi'i bar du 'gags par mthong /
translated: When that is stopped, he saw that aging and death are stopped.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rtogs pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rtogs pas /
translated: By realizing the forward and reverse sequences of dependent arising, the aspects of thorough affliction and complete purification,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing yid byung ste rnam par byang ba la mngon sum du phyogs nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing yid byung ste rnam par byang ba la mngon sum du phyogs nas /
translated: he became disenchanted and turned away from the suffering of saṃsāra.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod cing snying rje chung ste /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba spyod cing snying rje chung ste /
translated: He directly faced complete purification and practiced virtue such as the perfections for the sake of his own enlightenment and nirvāṇa.

original: sems can mang po'i don mi byed par rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i don mi byed par rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he had little compassion and did not work for the welfare of many sentient beings, it is called the “Vehicle of the Solitary Realizers.”

original: rang sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa bhi bha sha na lung bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni 'phags pa bhi bha sha na lung bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: states:🔽“One sees the profound dependent origination and realizes the expanse of reality that is without extremes or middle.”🔽The Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo mthong ba dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rtogs so zhes gsungs pa dang bo a'a ts'arya'i t'i ka las gzugs kyi phung po la chos la bdag med par rtogs so zhes 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo mthong ba dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rtogs so zhes gsungs pa dang bo a'a ts'arya'i t'i ka las gzugs kyi phung po la chos la bdag med par rtogs so zhes 'byung ba dang /
translated: “One realizes the selflessness of phenomena in the aggregate of form.”

original: mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i dus na yang slob dpon la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis chos nyid rtogs par nus te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i dus na yang slob dpon la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis chos nyid rtogs par nus te /
translated: And at the time of attaining realization, one is able to realize reality by oneself without relying on a master.

original: dbang po rno ba nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Thus, in terms of the sharpness of their faculties, they are superior to the sravakas.

original: theg pa chen po ni don dam par dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par rig cing /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni don dam par dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med par rig cing /
translated: The Mahayana is the knowledge that ultimately all things are devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med par rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu dngos po sgyu ma tsam du dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med par rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu dngos po sgyu ma tsam du dmigs pas /
translated: It is the realization that samsara and nirvana are nondual and the perception of things as mere illusions on the conventional level.

original: shes rab dang snying rje chen po dang ldan te /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje chen po dang ldan te /
translated: He is endowed with wisdom and great compassion.

original: 'khor ba yang mi spong /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang mi spong /
translated: He does not abandon samsara,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi len par sems can tham cad kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la spyod cing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi len par sems can tham cad kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la spyod cing /
translated: but for the sake of all sentient beings, he practices the ten perfections and

original: bdag dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub pa ste /
translated: accomplishes the perfect benefit of self and other.

original: mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, the ten bodhisattva stages together with the stage of buddhahood are called the Great Vehicle.

original: chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las /
analyzed: chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las /
translated: The Great Vehicle is superior to the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: @217a * // chen po rnam pa bdun gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: @217a * // chen po rnam pa bdun gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: by way of seven kinds of greatness.

original: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / las chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bdun ni dmigs pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dang / las chen po'o //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness are greatness of object, accomplishment, wisdom, effort, means, perfect achievement, and activity.

original: de la dmigs pa chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum dang / dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po 'bum dang / 'dus pa chen po 'bum la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum dang / dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po 'bum dang / 'dus pa chen po 'bum la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa /
translated: The great objective is the infinite scriptures of the universal vehicle, such as the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the Great Heap of Jewels in One Hundred Thousand Lines, and the Hundred Thousand in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam bshad pa'i chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam bshad pa'i chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the objective of the Dharma that explains the bodhisattva path.

original: bsgrub pa chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don thams cad bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don thams cad bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The great practice is the practice of all the aims of self and other.

original: ye shes chen po ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Great intuition is the realization of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du bya dka' ba rnam pa mang po la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa gsum du bya dka' ba rnam pa mang po la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Great effort is the application to many difficult practices for three measureless kalpas.

original: thabs mkhas pa chen po ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la mi gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen po ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la mi gnas pa'o ;
translated: Great skillful means is the non-abiding in cyclic life and in the great transcendence of suffering.

original: / yang dag par 'grub pa chen po ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med par 'grub po //
analyzed: / yang dag par 'grub pa chen po ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med par 'grub po //
translated: The great accomplishment is the accomplishment of the immeasurable qualities such as the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: las chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad bsgrub cing mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: las chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad bsgrub cing mdzad pa'o //
translated: The great activity is the accomplishment and performance of all the activities of the Buddha for as long as samsara lasts.

original: theg pa gsum du yang gsungs la gcig ces kyang gsungs pa gang bden /
analyzed: theg pa gsum du yang gsungs la gcig ces kyang gsungs pa gang bden /
translated: It is said that there are three vehicles and it is also said that there is one. Which is true?

original: ci las dgongs she na /🔽'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci las dgongs she na / 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir /
translated: What was the Buddha thinking when he said there are three vehicles?🔽It was in consideration of the disciples that he taught three vehicles.

original: mos pa'i rkyen tsam du dbang po'i rim pa dang sbyar nas theg pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: mos pa'i rkyen tsam du dbang po'i rim pa dang sbyar nas theg pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: In accordance with the levels of the disciples, he taught three vehicles as a mere condition for their interest.

original: theg pa gnyis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'khor bas skyo zhing sdug bsngal mi bzod pas /🔽de myur du zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rings thabs bsti ba'i gnas tsam du zad de /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas 'khor bas skyo zhing sdug bsngal mi bzod pas / de myur du zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rings thabs bsti ba'i gnas tsam du zad de /
translated: The two vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are merely a place of rest for those who are weary of samsara and cannot bear suffering.

original: gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas ma yin /
analyzed: gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas ma yin /
translated: They are a quick method for those who wish to attain peace quickly, but they are not a place of permanent nirvana.

original: 'bras bu thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sku ste /
translated: Having attained the result, they will have the body of a buddha.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs par mdzad cing /
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs par mdzad cing /
translated: They will realize the absence of self in phenomena.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa la spyod du bcug nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa la spyod du bcug nas /
translated: They will be induced to engage in the conduct of awakening.

original: des bsgrubs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: des bsgrubs nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Having accomplished that, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed buddhahood.

original: tha mar theg pa chen por 'du bas /
analyzed: tha mar theg pa chen por 'du bas /
translated: In the end, they will be included in the Great Vehicle.

original: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra says:

original: nyan thos zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i @217b 'od zer gyis bskul te /
analyzed: nyan thos zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i @217b 'od zer gyis bskul te /
translated: Those who abide in the śrāvakas’ untainted realm are inspired by the light rays of the tathāgatas.🔽They enter the Great Vehicle, and the vehicle is explained to be one.

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug cing theg pa gcig tu bshad pa dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug cing theg pa gcig tu bshad pa dang / dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Sublime Dharma states:

original: nyan thos mang po sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung bstan zhing //🔽theg pa gcig tu bshad pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis theg pa gsum du med de gcig tu zad do //
analyzed: nyan thos mang po sangs rgyas su 'grub par lung bstan zhing // theg pa gcig tu bshad pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis theg pa gsum du med de gcig tu zad do //
translated: Many śrāvakas are prophesied to become buddhas.🔽The vehicle is explained to be one.

original: mdo sde gzhan las rigs lnga dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las rigs lnga dang sbyar te /
translated: In other sūtras, the three vehicles are taught in terms of the five families.

original: theg pa gsum du bshad pa'i rigs lnga yang rigs yong gis de ltar nges te gtan du yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: theg pa gsum du bshad pa'i rigs lnga yang rigs yong gis de ltar nges te gtan du yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The five lineages explained in the three vehicle teaching are also definitely like that by the power of lineage, but they are not definitely always existent.

original: phrin las kyi dus la ltos te sngar phye bar zad do //
analyzed: phrin las kyi dus la ltos te sngar phye bar zad do //
translated: They are merely divided in terms of the time of activity.

original: mdo kha cig las zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i nyan thos ni de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos bskul kyang 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med do zhes 'byung ba dang / bden pa bzhi la nges pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: mdo kha cig las zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i nyan thos ni de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos bskul kyang 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med do zhes 'byung ba dang / bden pa bzhi la nges pa rnyed nas /
translated: Some sūtras say that śrāvakas who are one-sidedly peaceful lack the fortune to become buddhas even if they are urged by many tathāgatas.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ma thob pa'i bar du bsgyur du mi rung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ma thob pa'i bar du bsgyur du mi rung ba la bya'o //
translated: This refers to those who have gained certainty in the four truths but are not suitable to change until they obtain the result of an arhat.

original: mdo kha cig las dgra bcom pa ni sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra zhes 'byung ba dang / mching bu byi dor byas kyang rin po che bee d'uryar mi 'gyur ba'i dpes /
analyzed: mdo kha cig las dgra bcom pa ni sa bon tshig pa dang 'dra zhes 'byung ba dang / mching bu byi dor byas kyang rin po che bee d'uryar mi 'gyur ba'i dpes /
translated: Some sūtras say that arhats are like burned seeds and give the example of how a piece of glass cannot become a precious gem even if it is polished.🔽These statements that śrāvakas do not become buddhas

original: nyan thos sangs rgyas su mi 'grub pa skad 'byung ba yang /
analyzed: nyan thos sangs rgyas su mi 'grub pa skad 'byung ba yang /
translated: are not definitive.

original: thog ma nas theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya zhing don chung ngu nyid las su 'gyur pa theg pa dman pa la mi 'jug par dgag pa'i phyir smad pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma nas theg pa chen po la 'jug par bya zhing don chung ngu nyid las su 'gyur pa theg pa dman pa la mi 'jug par dgag pa'i phyir smad pa yin no //
translated: It is deprecated in order to prevent one from entering the Lesser Vehicle, which is of little benefit, and to cause one to enter the Great Vehicle from the very beginning.🔽If one does not accept this method, then it would contradict many sutras, such as the noble Samadhiraja, which state that all sentient beings possess the essence of the Tathagata,

original: tshul 'di ltar mi 'dod na ni 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po la sogs pa mdo sde mang po las sems cad thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin no zhes 'byung ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul 'di ltar mi 'dod na ni 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po la sogs pa mdo sde mang po las sems cad thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin no zhes 'byung ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: and that all sentient beings will become buddhas,🔽and that there is no one who is not a vessel,

original: snod ma yin pa gang yang med do zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / 'gal bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: snod ma yin pa gang yang med do zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / 'gal bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: and so on, up to

original: theg pa gnyis kyang tha mar theg pa chen por 'dus te /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyang tha mar theg pa chen por 'dus te /
translated: the two vehicles finally being included in the Great Vehicle.

original: tha mar theg pa gcig tu 'du bar mngon no //
analyzed: tha mar theg pa gcig tu 'du bar mngon no //
translated: It is evident that they are finally included in the One Vehicle.

original: ye shes bzhi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The four kinds of gnosis are mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, all-discerning gnosis, and all-accomplishing gnosis.

original: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa /🔽sangs rgyas kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa gzugs dang kha dog dang sku sna tshogs kun du ston pa'i gzhir gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gnas gyur ba /
analyzed: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa / sangs rgyas kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa gzugs dang kha dog dang sku sna tshogs kun du ston pa'i gzhir gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par gnas gyur ba /
translated: Mirror-like gnosis is the support for the display of various forms, colors, and bodies, endowed with the completely pure expanse of reality and great love and compassion.🔽It is the transformation of the consciousness of the ground of all, which is the support for the nonabiding nirvana of the buddhas.

original: bsnyel ba me mnga' ba ma lus pa la dmigs @218a * //
analyzed: bsnyel ba me mnga' ba ma lus pa la dmigs @218a * //
translated: It is the focus for all the buddhas’ activities, which never decline.

original: pa ; me long phyis pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan ci yang 'byung zhing snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: pa ; me long phyis pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan ci yang 'byung zhing snang ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as any image can appear and be reflected in a polished mirror,

original: de yang ye shes dang chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i gzhi yin pas /
analyzed: de yang ye shes dang chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i gzhi yin pas /
translated: this gnosis is the basis for the reflection of all gnosis and phenomena.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na /
translated: The primordial wisdom of equality, when the Bodhisattva realizes the Tathagatahood of the one taste of all phenomena on the first Bodhisattva ground,

original: bdag dang gzhan du mi byed cing mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i thob pa gang yin pa de nyid la dmigs shing gong nas gong du sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gyur te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mi byed cing mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i thob pa gang yin pa de nyid la dmigs shing gong nas gong du sbyangs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gyur te /
translated: is the attainment of the realization of equality without making distinctions between self and others.

original: shel dang beed'urya la sogs pa'i kha dog gi sku ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shel dang beed'urya la sogs pa'i kha dog gi sku ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the cause for the manifestation of the Buddha's form in the colors of crystal, lapis lazuli, and so forth.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas /
translated: The primordial wisdom of discernment, by the transformation of the defiled mind consciousness,

original: gzugs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur cing /
analyzed: gzugs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur cing /
translated: is the basis for all forms, samadhis, dhyanas, and absorptions.

original: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pas chos kyi char po 'bebs shing the tshom sna tshogs gcod pa dang mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pas rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //🔽bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug pas chos kyi char po 'bebs shing the tshom sna tshogs gcod pa dang mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pas rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'o // bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas /
translated: Since it is the knowledge that penetrates all objects of knowledge without obstruction, it rains the rain of Dharma and severs the various doubts. Since it focuses on the absence of attributes, it is free from all concepts.🔽The all accomplishing wisdom is the transformation of the consciousnesses of the five sense organs such as the eyes.🔽🔽

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dul ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du thabs sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba sgrub pa'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dul ba'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du thabs sna tshogs dpag tu med pas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba sgrub pa'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of accomplishment of activities is the basis for accomplishing the maturation and liberation of sentient beings in all worldly realms by means of immeasurable and various methods, in accordance with the thoughts and aspirations of those to be tamed, through the transformation of the five sense consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness.

original: sku gsum ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sbrul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sku gsum ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sbrul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The three bodies are the dharmakāya, the saṃbhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de la chos kyi sku ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gzugs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gzugs can ma yin pa /
translated: The dharmakāya is the nature of nonconceptual wisdom, which is not physical.

original: shes bya thams cad du khyab pa /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad du khyab pa /
translated: It pervades all objects of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de bzhin nyid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de bzhin nyid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa la bya'o //
translated: The greatness of the Buddha is the source of all good qualities such as meditative concentration, and so on, and it is the reality of the pure foundation consciousness.

original: de ltar ni ci mngon zhe na /🔽'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las sgrib pa thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni ci mngon zhe na / 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las sgrib pa thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: How is this so?🔽The noble Golden Light Sutra says:

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from all obscurations and because all virtuous qualities are perfected,

original: de kho na nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
translated: the reality and the perfect pristine awareness are called the Dharma body.🔽The noble Buddha Land Sutra also explains:

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta @218b bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta @218b bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The pure reality realm and the mirror-like pristine awareness are the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa yin la /
translated: The pure reality realm is the stainless suchness of phenomena.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas 'di gnyis ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas 'di gnyis ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Since mirror-like primordial wisdom is non-conceptual and focuses on suchness, these two are the Dharma Body.

original: tha snyad du tha dad pa skad du bya yang /
analyzed: tha snyad du tha dad pa skad du bya yang /
translated: Although they are conventionally said to be different,

original: dngos su ni mi dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed par dbyer med de de skad du dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i t'i ka dang / mdo sde rgyan gyi t'i ka las kyang bshad do //
analyzed: dngos su ni mi dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed par dbyer med de de skad du dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i t'i ka dang / mdo sde rgyan gyi t'i ka las kyang bshad do //
translated: in actuality they are inseparable, the one being the object of non-apprehension and the other being the agent of apprehension. This is explained in the Madhyāntavibhāga-ṭīkā and the Sūtrālaṃkāra-ṭīkā.

original: sku de ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dang ldan par ni 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: sku de ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa dang ldan par ni 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las rgyas par bshad do //
translated: The sūtras explain in detail that this body is endowed with samādhi and so forth in the Sūtra of Golden Light and the Buddha-bhūmi Sūtra.

original: mdo sde rgyan las me long lta bu'i ye shes de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang de yin no zhes 'byung ba ni de'i rgyur gyur pa tsam la bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las me long lta bu'i ye shes de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang de yin no zhes 'byung ba ni de'i rgyur gyur pa tsam la bya ste /
translated: In the Ornament of Mahāyāna Sūtras, it says that mirror-like primordial wisdom is also the enjoyment body of a buddha. This should be understood as referring to the mere cause of that body.

original: de nyid las ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin no zhes kyang bshad la /
analyzed: de nyid las ye shes thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin no zhes kyang bshad la /
translated: That text also explains that it is the source of all primordial wisdoms.

original: de'i t'i ka las de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i t'i ka las de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: And the Mahāyānasamgraha says, “Because it is the cause of that.🔽”

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni chos kyi sku zhes gsungs so //
translated: And the Sūtra of Golden Light says, “The transformation of the foundation consciousness is called the dharmakāya.🔽”

original: 'phags pa dung phreng gi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dung phreng gi mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Ārya Śaṅkhapāla Sūtra says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsal bar ma gyur ba'i tshe ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gsal bar ma gyur ba'i tshe ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: “When the essence of the tathāgata is not clear, it is called the foundation consciousness.🔽When it is clear, it is called the dharmakāya.

original: gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni chos sku zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu shin tu bsgoms pa'i nges par 'byung bas /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni chos sku zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so // 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid ni sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu shin tu bsgoms pa'i nges par 'byung bas /
translated: At the time of clarity, it is called the dharmakāya.🔽🔽The noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also says, “The characteristic of the Tathāgatas’ dharmakāya is the definite emergence of the ten grounds and the ten perfections that have been well cultivated.”🔽

original: gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: And the Sūtra of the Definitive Explanation of the Intent says, “The characteristic of the dharmakāya of the tathāgatas is the transformation that is the attainment of the culmination of the ten grounds and the ten perfections.🔽”

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the transformation of the foundation consciousness.

original: don bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos las kyang chos sku zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos las kyang chos sku zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called Dharma Body is

original: chos ni thog ma med pa nas rigs su gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la bya ste /
analyzed: chos ni thog ma med pa nas rigs su gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la bya ste /
translated: the lineage that has existed since beginningless time, the essence of the Tathagata,

original: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of all sentient beings.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas bsgribs pas dri ma can du gyur te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pas bsgribs pas dri ma can du gyur te /
translated: It is covered by what is not real, and so it is defiled.

original: gang gi tshe sbyor ba sngon du btang nas 'khrul pa dang bral ba de'i tshe rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyor ba sngon du btang nas 'khrul pa dang bral ba de'i tshe rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: When, through prior application, it is free from error, then it is the nature.

original: rang bzhin du gyur pa de ni chos kyi sku zhes bshad do //🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na chos kyi longs spyod chen po ma lus par @219a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gyur pa de ni chos kyi sku zhes bshad do // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na chos kyi longs spyod chen po ma lus par @219a * //
translated: That which is the nature is explained as the Dharma Body.

original: myong ba mdzad pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: myong ba mdzad pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is the body of Vairocana, etc., which experiences the great enjoyment of the Dharma in the circle of the assembly of Bodhisattvas,

original: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and which is endowed with all the excellent major and minor marks.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi and the Ta ki

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su bshad do //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su bshad do //
translated: explain that the mirror-like wisdom is the transformation of the container consciousness, and the wisdom of equality and the wisdom of individual realization are the transformations of the active consciousnesses.

original: de yang rung bar ci mngon zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang rung bar ci mngon zhe na ;
translated: What is the evidence that this is correct?

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Suvarnaprabhasa Sutra says that the transformation of the defiled mind is the beatific body.

original: de mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yon no //
analyzed: de mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes yon no //
translated: And that is the wisdom of equality.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kye sa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kye sa las kyang /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi also says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la /
translated: The individual-realization wisdom of the Tathagatas

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i chos rgya chen po ston pa dag snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i chos rgya chen po ston pa dag snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: appears to teach the extensive Dharma endowed with the powers of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje ri rab kyi zom las kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni bsod nams chen po'i rgyu mthun pa zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje ri rab kyi zom las kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni bsod nams chen po'i rgyu mthun pa zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The Arya-vajra-suvarasakrta also says that the beatific body is the natural outcome of great merit.

original: de ni ye shes gnyis dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi sku'o ;
analyzed: de ni ye shes gnyis dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi sku'o ;
translated: It is the form body endowed with the two kinds of intuition.

original: / sprul pa'i sku ni sh'akya thub pa'i sku la sogs pa sprul pa gang gis sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: / sprul pa'i sku ni sh'akya thub pa'i sku la sogs pa sprul pa gang gis sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa ste /
translated: The emanation body is the emanation body of Shakyamuni, etc., by which it acts for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the intuition of successful activity.

original: de ci mngon zhe na /🔽'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o zhes gsungs la ;🔽'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las kyang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni sprul pa'i sku yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na / 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o zhes gsungs la ; 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i t'i ka las kyang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni sprul pa'i sku yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Why is this?🔽The noble Golden Light Sutra also says, “The transformation of the active consciousness is the emanation body.”🔽And the noble Buddha-field of Buddha states, “The intuition of successful activity is the emanation body.”

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las kyang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni lus sprul pa'i las byung ba des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can las dang bzo'i gnas thams cad kyis rgyags dregs pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las kyang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni lus sprul pa'i las byung ba des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can las dang bzo'i gnas thams cad kyis rgyags dregs pa rnams la /
translated: The noble Buddha-field of Buddha Sutra also says, “The intuition of successful activity is the emanation body, which is the emanation of the body of the Tathagatas, by which they act for the sake of sentient beings.”

original: las dang bzo'i gnas thams cad nye bar bstan te /
analyzed: las dang bzo'i gnas thams cad nye bar bstan te /
translated: He teaches all the arts and crafts.

original: zil gyis mnan nas thabs mkhas pa des kyang bstan pa la 'dzud de /
