analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas thabs mkhas pa des kyang bstan pa la 'dzud de /
translated: Having overwhelmed them, he introduces them to the teaching by that skillful means.🔽He ripens them and liberates them.

original: de yongs su smin par byed rnam par grol bar byed do zhes sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa rgya cher bka' stsal to ;
analyzed: de yongs su smin par byed rnam par grol bar byed do zhes sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi sprul pa rgya cher bka' stsal to ;
translated: Thus he speaks extensively about the emanations of body, speech, and mind.

original: / de la sku sprul pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / de la sku sprul pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The emanation of body is threefold:

original: bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa dang / ma 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa dang / ma 'brel pa'o //
translated: related to one’s own body, related to the bodies of others, and unrelated.

original: de la bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa ni bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa ni bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa'o //
translated: The emanation related to one’s own body is the manifestation of one’s own body in the form of a universal monarch, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni @219b bdud la sogs pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni @219b bdud la sogs pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa'o //
translated: The emanation related to the bodies of others is the manifestation of the bodies of others, such as Māra, in the form of a Buddha, and so on.

original: ma 'brel pa ni sa la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun du kun du ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dpag tu med pa kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa ni sa la sogs pa rin po che sna bdun du kun du ston pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dpag tu med pa kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and those unrelated to either, such as the Buddha’s manifestation of countless buddha-bodies.

original: gsung sprul ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsung sprul ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The emanations of speech are also of three kinds:

original: bdag gi lus dang 'brel ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa go bar mdzad pa'o //🔽gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel na ni gang gis nyan thos la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang 'brel ba ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa go bar mdzad pa'o // gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel na ni gang gis nyan thos la sogs pa yang /
translated: those related to one’s own body, such as the Buddha’s manifestation of the Brahma-like voice that is heard throughout infinite world-systems;

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gis theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gis theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: those related to the bodies of others, such as the Buddha’s manifestation of the speech of the disciples and so on, which teaches the Dharma of the Great Vehicle;

original: ma 'brel ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa la chos bstan pa'i sgra 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa la chos bstan pa'i sgra 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and those unrelated to either, such as the sound of the Dharma that arises from the sky.

original: thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis te /
analyzed: thugs sprul pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis te /
translated: The emanations of mind are of two kinds:🔽those related to one’s own mind, such as the Buddha’s manifestation of the realization of all phenomena;

original: bdag chos thams cad thugs su chud pa dang / gzhan sems de bzhin du bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag chos thams cad thugs su chud pa dang / gzhan sems de bzhin du bsgyur ba ste /
translated: and those related to the minds of others, such as the Buddha’s manifestation of the transformation of others’ minds in the same way.

original: des na shes rab chud du dag kyang chos zab mo khong du chud pa dang / dran pa nyams pa yang dran pa thob ces bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na shes rab chud du dag kyang chos zab mo khong du chud pa dang / dran pa nyams pa yang dran pa thob ces bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, even though the wisdom of the Buddha is unfathomable, it is said that one can speak of its fathoming the profound Dharma, and that one can speak of the attainment of mindfulness even though mindfulness has been lost.

original: sku gnyis la rtog pa mnga' 'am mi mnga' zhe na de gnyis te chos kyi sku rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba las byung bas rtog pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis la rtog pa mnga' 'am mi mnga' zhe na de gnyis te chos kyi sku rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba las byung bas rtog pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Do the two bodies have conceptualization or not? The Dharma Body does not have conceptualization because it arises from the absence of conceptualization.

original: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang rtog pa yod pa 'dra mod kyi de bzhin nyid la ni rtog pa med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang rtog pa yod pa 'dra mod kyi de bzhin nyid la ni rtog pa med do //
translated: The noble Golden Light Sutra says, “Although there is conceptualization, there is no conceptualization in suchness.

original: gsum du bgrang ba yod mod kyi dngos po ni gsum du med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum du bgrang ba yod mod kyi dngos po ni gsum du med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Although there is counting as three, there is no entity that is three.”

original: mdo sde du ma las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mdo sde du ma las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: And many sutras say, “The Tathagata is always in meditative equipoise.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mnga' 'am mi mnga' thams cad mkhyen pas dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen tam /🔽spyi'i mtshan nyid mkhyen /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pas mkhyen tam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mnga' 'am mi mnga' thams cad mkhyen pas dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen tam / spyi'i mtshan nyid mkhyen / rtog pa dang bcas pas mkhyen tam /
translated: Does the Omniscient One know the specific characteristics of things or not?🔽Does He know them conceptually or not?

original: rnam par mi rtog par mkhyen zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par mkhyen zhe na /
translated: Does He know them nonconceptually or not?

original: rnam par mi rtog bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bzhin du rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: He knows all specific and general characteristics nonconceptually.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa' mdzad cing sgrib pa ma byang /🔽lhun gyis ma grub /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa' mdzad cing sgrib pa ma byang / lhun gyis ma grub /
translated: When the Bodhisattva was not yet a Buddha,🔽when He had not yet attained spontaneous,

original: dbang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma brnyes pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma brnyes pa'i tshe /
translated: unimaginable mastery,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis dngos po thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du gzigs la /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis dngos po thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du gzigs la /
translated: when He was in meditative equipoise, He saw the general characteristics of all things, their emptiness, with nonconceptual gnosis.

original: de las bzhings nas rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sgyu ma @220a * //
analyzed: de las bzhings nas rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sgyu ma @220a * //
translated: And when He rose from that equipoise, He saw the specific characteristics of things with pure mundane gnosis.

original: tsam du rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen pa de gong nas gong du sbyangs pas rtog pa bsal te sgrib pa byang ba'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa la lhun gyis te mnyam par 'jog pa dang / bzhengs pa mi mnga' bar shes bya ji snyed pa de thams cad dus gcig tu mngon du gyur te /
analyzed: tsam du rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen pa de gong nas gong du sbyangs pas rtog pa bsal te sgrib pa byang ba'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi sa la lhun gyis te mnyam par 'jog pa dang / bzhengs pa mi mnga' bar shes bya ji snyed pa de thams cad dus gcig tu mngon du gyur te /
translated: Through training in this knowledge of the individual no-self more and more, conceptual thoughts are eliminated and the result of the purification of obscurations is that on the level of buddhahood, without any need for deliberate concentration or postmeditation, all knowable phenomena are simultaneously actualized.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bas rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma tsam du mkhyen kyang dngos por mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bas rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma tsam du mkhyen kyang dngos por mi dmigs /
translated: And because they are free of conceptual thoughts, although they know the mere illusion-like individual characteristics of phenomena, they do not apprehend them as real entities.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: They do not grasp them as having attributes.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: So there is no question of their being tainted by the faults of subject and object.

original: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And as the Buddhavatamsaka sutra says:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dgongs pa ni chags pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The transcendent, accomplished, perfect buddhas are free of attachment.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par yongs su sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par yongs su sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Their intention is the result of training for inexpressibly inexpressible hundreds of thousands of millions of eons.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The entire world is the domain of the bodhisattva.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad yul du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad yul du gyur ba'o //
translated: The entire realm of phenomena is the domain of the bodhisattva.

original: dus gsum thams cad la dgongs pa gcig gis chags pa med par mkhyen zhing thugs su chud pa'i yul dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad la dgongs pa gcig gis chags pa med par mkhyen zhing thugs su chud pa'i yul dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva has the domain of knowing and understanding the three times with a single thought, without obstruction.

original: 'phags pa chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together also says,🔽For example, a magician

original: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po zhig / sprul pa thar bar bya phyir brtson //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po zhig / sprul pa thar bar bya phyir brtson //
translated: strives to liberate his magical creations.

original: des ni snga nas de shes pas //
analyzed: des ni snga nas de shes pas //
translated: Because he knows them beforehand,

original: sprul pa de la chags pa med //🔽srid gsum sprul pa 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: sprul pa de la chags pa med // srid gsum sprul pa 'dra ba ni //
translated: he is not attached to those magical creations.🔽The skilled one who is perfectly awakened

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub mkhas pas shes //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub mkhas pas shes //
translated: knows the three worlds to be like a magical creation.

original: 'gro ba'i ched du go ba gos te //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ched du go ba gos te //
translated: He is covered with the skin of understanding for the sake of the world,

original: 'gro ba de dag snga nas shes //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag snga nas shes //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: and he knows those worlds beforehand.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi sa la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mnga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi sa la dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes mnga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, on the level of buddhahood, there would be no pure mundane gnosis.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa las /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa las /
translated: Thus, from nonconceptuality,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: how do the emanations of body, speech and mind occur?

original: sngon thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par thugs dam bcas shing smon lam chen po btab nas /
analyzed: sngon thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad par thugs dam bcas shing smon lam chen po btab nas /
translated: Previously, through the power of great compassion, having made the promise to act for the benefit of all sentient beings without exception and having made great aspirations,

original: thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa mthar phyir te/ chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa lhun gyis grub nas /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa mthar phyir te/ chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa lhun gyis grub nas /
translated: having perfected the cultivation of method and wisdom, having spontaneously accomplished the pure dharmakāya,

original: dbang dang thing nge 'dzin dang mthu dang byin gyi rlabs dang shugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pas /
analyzed: dbang dang thing nge 'dzin dang mthu dang byin gyi rlabs dang shugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pas /
translated: having attained inconceivable power, samādhi, strength, blessings and force,

original: sprul pa thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar gdul bya yid bzhin du lhun gyis grub par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bar gdul bya yid bzhin du lhun gyis grub par 'byung ste /
translated: all emanations occur spontaneously for disciples in accordance with their wishes without any conceptuality.

original: dper na @220b yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ni 'di dang 'di dbyung zhing sems can la phan gdags so snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na @220b yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ni 'di dang 'di dbyung zhing sems can la phan gdags so snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: For example, a wish-fulfilling gem and a wish-granting tree do not think, “I will produce this and that and benefit sentient beings.”

original: 'on kyang mthu chen po dang ldan pa de las sems can skal ba can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par ci 'dod 'byung ba zhing phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthu chen po dang ldan pa de las sems can skal ba can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par ci 'dod 'byung ba zhing phan 'dogs so //
translated: However, in accordance with the wishes of fortunate sentient beings, whatever is desired arises from that which possesses great power, and it benefits the field.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'di ltar sprul lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang 'di ltar sprul lo //
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata also does not think, “I will emanate this,

original: 'di skad bshad do //🔽'di lta bur bcos so //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad do // 'di lta bur bcos so //
translated: I will explain this,🔽I will create this,

original: 'di ltar pan 'dogs so snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar pan 'dogs so snyam du mi dgongs mod kyi /
translated: I will benefit this.”

original: chos sku dbang dang mthu chen po la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa de las /
analyzed: chos sku dbang dang mthu chen po la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa de las /
translated: However, from that which possesses the inconceivable great power of the dharmakāya,

original: sems can skal pa ci yod pa dang mthun par sku mthong ba dang / gsung thos pa dang / dran pa rnyed par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i sku sprul pa sna tshogs yid bzhin du 'byung zhing phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can skal pa ci yod pa dang mthun par sku mthong ba dang / gsung thos pa dang / dran pa rnyed par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i sku sprul pa sna tshogs yid bzhin du 'byung zhing phan 'dogs so //
translated: In accordance with the fortune of sentient beings, the various emanations of the Buddha's body appear in accordance with wishes, and benefit by means of seeing the body, hearing the speech, and attaining recollection.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: It is said in the noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral na /
translated: Bhagavan, if the dharmakāya of the tathāgatas is free from compositional activity,

original: ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa ma mchis par sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa ma mchis par sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: how is it that the mind arises without compositional activity?

original: 'jam dpal sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is due to the compositional activity of previously cultivating method and wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na sems med par gnyis kyis log pa'i tshe /🔽phyir sad par mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na sems med par gnyis kyis log pa'i tshe / phyir sad par mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this: for example, when two people are asleep and dreaming,🔽they may awaken without any compositional activity.

original: sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed kyi dbang gis sad par 'gyur ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed kyi dbang gis sad par 'gyur ba'ang yod do //
translated: However, due to the power of previous compositional activity, they will awaken.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang ldang bar mngon par 'du byed pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang ldang bar mngon par 'du byed pa med mod kyi /
translated: Also, when entering meditative attainment in cessation, there is no manifest composition for rising from it.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed kyi dbang gis ldang ba yang yod do //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed kyi dbang gis ldang ba yang yod do //
translated: However, there is rising by the power of previous composition.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems 'byung ba yang sngon gyi thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems 'byung ba yang sngon gyi thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las shes par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, the arising of the mind of a tathagata should be understood from the manifest composition of previously cultivating method and wisdom.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, the Golden Light Sutra says:

original: rigs kyi bu dper na nyi ma dang zla ba la yang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na nyi ma dang zla ba la yang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: Son of noble family, for example, the sun and moon have no conceptuality.

original: chu dang me long la yang rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: chu dang me long la yang rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: Water and mirrors also have no conceptuality.

original: 'od snang ba la yang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'od snang ba la yang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: Light also has no conceptuality.

original: gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
translated: However, a reflection arises from the assembly of three.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes la yang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes la yang rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, the limit of reality and correct wisdom have no conceptuality.

original: smon lam gyi dbang dang sems can gyi mthu las /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang dang sems can gyi mthu las /
translated: However, by the power of aspirations and the power of sentient beings,

original: @221a * // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku 'byung po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @221a * // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku 'byung po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The enjoyment body and emanation body are the “appearances. ”

original: de skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the Sūtra Teaching the Secrets of the Tathāgatas says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun rnams ni bsgribs pa mi mnga' zhing lhun gyis grub la mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun rnams ni bsgribs pa mi mnga' zhing lhun gyis grub la mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar gnas so //
translated: The streams of the wisdom of the tathāgatas are unobstructed, spontaneous, and effortless.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa thams cad la yang gzigs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa thams cad la yang gzigs so //
translated: They see all the activities of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: They know the afflictions and purification of all sentient beings.

original: de'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mkhyen pa yang bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mkhyen pa yang bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: They do not forget the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni lhun gyis grub cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' bar mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni lhun gyis grub cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' bar mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bar 'jug go //
translated: These qualities of the tathāgatas are spontaneous, unobstructed, and effortless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang yang bral la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang yang bral la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas kyang mi 'dor ro ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas kyang mi 'dor ro ;
translated: yet he does not abandon the state of meditative absorption.

original: / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad la /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad la /
translated: He performs all the activities of a buddha,

original: de'i chos thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi gang du yang mi chags so //
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi gang du yang mi chags so //
translated: yet his wisdom, which is free from attachment to any phenomenon, is not attached to anything.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāntamati, it is like this:

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni sems kyang mi mnga' ;
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa gang yin pa de la ni sems kyang mi mnga' ;
translated: The second thus-gone one, who is an emanation of the Thus-Gone One, does not have a mind,

original: yid kyang mi mnga'/
analyzed: yid kyang mi mnga'/
translated: does not have a mentality,

original: rnam par shes pa yang mi mnga'/
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang mi mnga'/
translated: does not have consciousness,

original: sku'i 'du byed kyang mi mnga'/
analyzed: sku'i 'du byed kyang mi mnga'/
translated: does not have physical activity,

original: gsung gi 'du byed kyang mi mnga'/
analyzed: gsung gi 'du byed kyang mi mnga'/
translated: does not have verbal activity,🔽and does not have mental activity.

original: thugs kyi 'du byed kyang mi mnga' mod kyi /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi 'du byed kyang mi mnga' mod kyi / 'di lta ste /
translated: However,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad do //
translated: through the power of the Buddha, he performs all the activities of a buddha.

original: de yang lhun gyis grub cing /
analyzed: de yang lhun gyis grub cing /
translated: Moreover, this is spontaneous and

original: bsgribs pa mi mnga' la /
analyzed: bsgribs pa mi mnga' la /
translated: He is not obscured,

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad do //
translated: and he acts without deliberate effort.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du /
translated: Śāntamati, in the same way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sprul pa dang mtshungs par mnyam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sprul pa dang mtshungs par mnyam mo //
translated: the Tathāgata is the same as a magical creation.

original: sprul pa'i chos nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: sprul pa'i chos nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: By the nature of a magical creation, he is nonconceptual.

original: de la sku'i rtsom pa dang / gsung gi rtsom pa dang / thugs kyi rtsom pa yang mi snang la /
analyzed: de la sku'i rtsom pa dang / gsung gi rtsom pa dang / thugs kyi rtsom pa yang mi snang la /
translated: In him, the composition of the body, the composition of speech, and the composition of the mind do not appear,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad de /🔽de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad de / de yang lhun gyis grub cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' la /
translated: and yet he performs all the activities of a buddha.🔽He does so spontaneously, without being obscured,

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' bas mdzad do //
translated: and without deliberate effort.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du @221b chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid du @221b chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Śāntamati, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena as having the nature of a magical creation.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can la thugs brtse bas de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sems can la thugs brtse bas de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: And after fully awakening, he taught it out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba ste /
translated: Śāntimati, this is also a secret of the mind of the Tathāgata.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi 'dor la /
translated: He does not abandon the state of meditative equipoise,

original: sems can thams cad la rnam par rig par yang mdzad pas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam par rig par yang mdzad pas /
translated: and he also makes it known to all sentient beings.

original: thugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, his mind is inconceivable.

original: sku gsum rtag gam mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: sku gsum rtag gam mi rtag ce na /
translated: Are the three bodies permanent or impermanent?

original: chos kyi sku ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos las kyang rtag par bshad de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos las kyang rtag par bshad de /
translated: The Dharma body is explained as permanent in the sūtras and the treatises.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It says, “Whether a tathāgata appears or not, the dharmatā of phenomena remains.”

original: de lta na mu stegs can gyi bdag rtag par 'dod pa dang 'dra bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na mu stegs can gyi bdag rtag par 'dod pa dang 'dra bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If that is so, is it not similar to the tīrthikas’ assertion that the self is permanent?

original: de dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: It is not similar to that.

original: rtag pa ni de bzhin nyid la bya na /
analyzed: rtag pa ni de bzhin nyid la bya na /
translated: If permanence is taken to be suchness,

original: de ni dngos por gzung du med pas de nyid kyang bdag ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni dngos por gzung du med pas de nyid kyang bdag ma yin la /
translated: Since it cannot be grasped as a real thing, it is not the self.

original: de la gang zag gi dngos po dang / chos kyi dngos po'i bdag kyang med pas de ltar mi 'dra'o //🔽de lta bas na de ni don du na rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi dngos po dang / chos kyi dngos po'i bdag kyang med pas de ltar mi 'dra'o // de lta bas na de ni don du na rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: And since there is no self of persons or of phenomena in it, it is not like that.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in reality, it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?🔽In the noble Descent into Laṅkā Sutra,

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: it says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “The Tathāgata is not permanent,

original: rtag tu zin na ni rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu zin na ni rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: because if he were permanent, he would be a cause.

original: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed pa thams cad kyi rgyu ni ma byas pa rtag pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed pa thams cad kyi rgyu ni ma byas pa rtag pa ste /
translated: Mahāmati, the cause of all tīrthikas is unmade permanence.

original: de bas na ma byas pa rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ma byas pa rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of unmade permanence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata is not permanent.

original: mi rtag na ni byas pa'i mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rtag na ni byas pa'i mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: If he were impermanent, he would be an impermanent product.”🔽And in the noble Golden Light Sutra,

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: it says,

original: rigs kyi bu sku gsum ni rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod pas rtag pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sku gsum ni rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod pas rtag pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: Son of a good family! The three bodies are called permanent because there is a synonym for permanence,

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod pas mi rtag pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod pas mi rtag pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and they are called impermanent because there is a synonym for impermanence.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni thabs mkhas pas gnas thams cad rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi chad par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni thabs mkhas pas gnas thams cad rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun mi chad par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir rtag pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is permanent because, through skillful means, it turns the wheel of the Dharma in all places without interruption, in accordance with the conditions.

original: de rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir spyod pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi 'byung bas mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir spyod pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi 'byung bas mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called impermanent because, since it is not the root, the great practice is not actually present.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rgyun mi chad de /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rgyun mi chad de /
translated: The enjoyment body is uninterrupted.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos 'dzin zhing sdud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos 'dzin zhing sdud pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it holds and gathers the unshared qualities of all buddhas,

original: sems can mi zad pas na spyod pa mi zad de de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can mi zad pas na spyod pa mi zad de de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: and because sentient beings are inexhaustible, the practice is inexhaustible, and therefore it is permanent.

original: de rtsa ba ma yin pa'i @222a * //
analyzed: de rtsa ba ma yin pa'i @222a * //
translated: Because it is not the root,

original: phyir spyod pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi 'byung bas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: phyir spyod pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa mngon du mi 'byung bas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: the great practice is not actually present, and therefore it is impermanent.

original: chos kyi sku ni 'dus byas kyi chos ma yin zhing mtshan ma tha dad pa med la rtsa ba dang gzhi yin pas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni 'dus byas kyi chos ma yin zhing mtshan ma tha dad pa med la rtsa ba dang gzhi yin pas rtag pa'o //
translated: The Dharma body is not a conditioned dharma, and since it is without different characteristics and is the root and ground, it is permanent.

original: rigs kyi bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na 'phags pa'i ye shes med do ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las gud na 'phags pa'i ye shes med do ;
translated: Son of good family, apart from nonconceptual wisdom there is no noble wisdom.

original: / yang dag pa'i mtha'i chos dang bral na 'phags pa'i spyod yul med do //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i mtha'i chos dang bral na 'phags pa'i spyod yul med do //
translated: Apart from the dharmas of the perfect limit, there is no noble sphere of activity.

original: yang dag pa'i rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gcig pa'ang ma yin tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam pa 'di gnyis ni gcig pa'ang ma yin tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: These two perfect aspects are neither the same nor different.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / spyod yul rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sku ni shes rab rnam par dag pa dang / spyod yul rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma body is said to be endowed with the perfection of purity, with the purity of wisdom and the purity of the sphere of activity.

original: chos kyi sku la brten nas ting nge 'dzin chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la brten nas ting nge 'dzin chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In dependence on the Dharma body, the inconceivable great samādhi manifests.

original: ye shes chen po thams cad kyang snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes chen po thams cad kyang snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: All great wisdoms also appear.

original: de lta bas na sku gnyis kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la brten nas mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sku gnyis kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la brten nas mngon du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the two bodies manifest in dependence on meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: chos kyi sku ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid la brten pas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid la brten pas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma body is called “permanent” because it is based on the nature of self.

original: bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “self”

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten pas bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po la brten pas bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and is called “bliss” because it is based on great meditative stabilization.

original: ye shes chen po la brten pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po la brten pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “purity” because it is based on great wisdom.

original: de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par zhugs pa mnga' mdzad pa bde zhing skyid pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag par zhugs pa mnga' mdzad pa bde zhing skyid pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to be “endowed with the practice of permanence, the practice of bliss, and the practice of purity.”

original: sems can las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa rang dbang med pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par ma dag pa'i gnyen por de skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sems can las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa rang dbang med pa sdug bsngal ba rnam par ma dag pa'i gnyen por de skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Because sentient beings are impermanent, powerless, suffering, and impure, due to being compounded by karma and afflictions, the Buddha taught the Dharma in this way as an antidote to that.

original: yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: Also, that same sūtra says:

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi sku ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ldan pa ni mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi sku ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ldan pa ni mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: Such a dharmakāya endowed with meditative concentration and wisdom is beyond all signs.

original: mtshan ma la mi chags pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mi chags pa /
translated: It is not attached to signs.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: It is nonconceptual.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa ste de ni dbu ma'i lam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa ste de ni dbu ma'i lam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is neither permanent nor impermanent. That is the middle way.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra also says,

original: ji srid du tshig gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de srid du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du tshig gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de srid du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: For as long as the conceptualization of words engages, there is the fault of permanence and impermanence.

original: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa'i blo zad pas byis pa rnams kyi rtag pa dang / mi rtag par lta ba ldog ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa'i blo zad pas byis pa rnams kyi rtag pa dang / mi rtag par lta ba ldog ste /
translated: Mahāmati, because of the exhaustion of the conceptual mind, the views of permanence and impermanence of the childish are reversed,

original: dben pa'i blo zad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dben pa'i blo zad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: but not because of the exhaustion of the mind of isolation.

original: de lta bas na @222b bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshig gis brjod du med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na @222b bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshig gis brjod du med do //
translated: Therefore, it is inconceivable and inexpressible.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / mdo sde rgyan las sku gsum char rtag ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / mdo sde rgyan las sku gsum char rtag ste /
translated: The Compendium of the Mahāyāna and the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras say that all three bodies are permanent.

original: chos kyi sku ni mi 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'o //🔽longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad pas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni mi 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'o // longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni chos kyi longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad pas /
translated: The Dharma Body is permanent by nature, because it is immutable.

original: mi nyams pa'i rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi nyams pa'i rtag pa'o //
translated: The Enjoyment Body is permanent in the sense of not wasting away, because the enjoyment of Dharma is uninterrupted.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni yang dang yang 'byung bas rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni yang dang yang 'byung bas rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
translated: The Emanation Body is permanent in the sense of a continuity, because it arises again and again.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sku gnyis ni chos kyi sku rtag pa la brten pas rtag pa'o zhes bya ba bshad pa'ang don du na gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sku gnyis ni chos kyi sku rtag pa la brten pas rtag pa'o zhes bya ba bshad pa'ang don du na gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, in another way, the two Bodies are permanent because they are based on the permanent Dharma Body.🔽In some scriptures, it is said to be permanent, and you should believe it.🔽It is said to be impermanent, and you should believe it.🔽It is said to exist, and you should believe it.🔽It is said not to exist, and you should believe it.

original: mdo kha cig las rtag ces bshad na'ang yid ches par gyis shig / mi rtag ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / yod ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / med ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / rtag pa yang🔽ma yin / mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mdo kha cig las rtag ces bshad na'ang yid ches par gyis shig / mi rtag ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / yod ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / med ces bshad na yang yid ches par gyis shig / rtag pa yang ma yin / mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is said to be both permanent and impermanent,🔽and you should believe it.

original: yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is said to be neither permanent nor impermanent,🔽and you should believe it.

original: med pa yang ma yin zhes bshad na yid ches par gyis shig ces 'byung ba yang sgra tsam gyi phyir 'brang ste /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin zhes bshad na yid ches par gyis shig ces 'byung ba yang sgra tsam gyi phyir 'brang ste /
translated: If I say it is not nonexistent, then you should believe it.

original: de ltar gzung ba yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba yang ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not apprehended in that way.

original: dgongs pa'i don rtogs par byas la /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i don rtogs par byas la /
translated: You should understand the meaning of the intention,

original: de ltar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba yin no //
translated: and then apprehend it in that way.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the eye consciousness, the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, the mental consciousness,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the afflicted mind, and the store consciousness.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: sngon po tsam du yul gyi mtshan nyid shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po tsam du yul gyi mtshan nyid shes pa yin gyi /
translated: It is a cognition that has the characteristic of an object, such as blue,

original: 'di ni sngon po'i zhes rtog pa dang 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po'i zhes rtog pa dang 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not mixed with the thought this is blue.

original: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'ang tshul 'di dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'ang tshul 'di dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same holds for the auditory, olfactory, gustatory, and tactile consciousnesses.

original: 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyis phyi rol gyi yul la dmigs pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyis phyi rol gyi yul la dmigs pa ste ;
translated: These six consciousnesses are by nature directed toward external objects.

original: de bzhin nyid la nam yang mi dmigs pas gcig tu zad pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la nam yang mi dmigs pas gcig tu zad pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since they never apprehend suchness, they are exclusively impure.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid dang chos la brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid dang chos la brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: The mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and mental objects.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa gang yang rung 'gags ma thag pa'o //🔽chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa dang / zag pa dang @223a * //
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa gang yang rung 'gags ma thag pa'o // chos ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa dang / zag pa dang @223a * //
translated: The mental faculty is the immediately past state of any of the six consciousnesses.

original: bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad de /
analyzed: bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad de /
translated: Mental objects are all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, as well as pure phenomena.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The mental consciousness has all phenomena as its objects.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni zag dang bcas pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni zag dang bcas pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness can be either pure or impure.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po 'di dag ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gsum char du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po 'di dag ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gsum char du 'gyur te /
translated: These six consciousnesses are of three types: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: sems las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa gang dang ldan pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate according to the mental factors that accompany them.

original: 'di dag ni sems las byung ba kun du 'gro ba dang / yul so sor nges pa dang / dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / tshor ba'ang gsum char dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems las byung ba kun du 'gro ba dang / yul so sor nges pa dang / dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / tshor ba'ang gsum char dang ldan no //
translated: They are associated with the universal mental factors, those that have specific objects, the virtuous mental factors, the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the three feelings.

original: de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rgyun mi chad pa'i sa bon rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags dang rnam pa gnyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / rang gi rgyun mi chad pa'i sa bon rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags dang rnam pa gnyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: They have two types of seeds: seeds that will mature as a result, either virtuous or nonvirtuous, and seeds that perpetuate their own continuity, which are the maturational impregnations and the natural impregnations.

original: / yul la 'jug pa 'di dag ni bstan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: / yul la 'jug pa 'di dag ni bstan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: These consciousnesses that engage objects are not taught in the Abhidharma.

original: 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / brgyal ba dang / gnyid stug pos non pa na ldog go //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / brgyal ba dang / gnyid stug pos non pa na ldog go //
translated: It is suspended in the state of non-perception, in the attainment of non-perception, in the attainment of cessation, in fainting, and in deep sleep.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni dbang po dang yul gzhan la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin gyi /🔽kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la brten te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni dbang po dang yul gzhan la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin gyi / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la brten te /
translated: The afflicted mind does not arise in dependence on other faculties and objects.🔽It arises in dependence on the store consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs nas 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises in dependence on the store consciousness as its object.

original: ji ltar de la brten te 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la brten te 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does it arise in dependence on that?

original: kun gzhi ni de'i sa bon gyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi ni de'i sa bon gyi gnas yin te /
translated: The store consciousness is the support of the seeds of the afflicted mind.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi bag chags de la gnas pas na de la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi bag chags de la gnas pas na de la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the afflicted mind is supported by the propensities of affliction, it arises in dependence on that.

original: ji ltar de la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la dmigs she na /
translated: How does it have that as its object?

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang ldan te /
translated: The afflicted mind is associated with the view of real self-existence, etc.

original: de'i phyir nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rnam pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rnam pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, the store consciousness is the object of the view of a self and the conceit “I am. ”

original: 'di ni sems las byung ba'i chos kun du 'gro ba lnga dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang rtag tu ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems las byung ba'i chos kun du 'gro ba lnga dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang rtag tu ldan no //
translated: It is always associated with the five omnipresent mental activities, the four passions that are always manifest, and the two changeable passions.

original: tshor ba gsum las ni tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan no //🔽nyon mongs pa bzhi ni bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu chags pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum las ni tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan no // nyon mongs pa bzhi ni bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal dang / bdag tu chags pa ste /
translated: Among the three feelings, it is associated with the feeling of indifference.🔽The four passions are the view of a self, self-conceit, self-love, and ignorance of self.

original: 'di bzhis bsgribs pa ni @223b nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: 'di bzhis bsgribs pa ni @223b nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The store consciousness is defiled by these four passions, and it is defiled by the four passions that are always manifest.

original: bsgribs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi dge ba rnams dang ldan mi srid do //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi dge ba rnams dang ldan mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for the store consciousness to be associated with the other passions, because the defiled manas is not associated with the bad passions.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mi dge ba rnams dang mi ldan pas rnam par smin pa 'phen mi nus pa dang ngar 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis nga sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mi dge ba rnams dang mi ldan pas rnam par smin pa 'phen mi nus pa dang ngar 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis nga sbyin pa byed do //
translated: Therefore, the defiled manas is not associated with the bad passions, and it cannot project a new retribution. It is the support for the view of a self, etc., and it is the support for the conceit “I am. ”

original: nga srog gcod pa byed do //
analyzed: nga srog gcod pa byed do //
translated: I will draw.

original: nga ri mo 'dra'o snyam pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i gnas skabs su 'ang 'byung ba lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga ri mo 'dra'o snyam pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i gnas skabs su 'ang 'byung ba lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It occurs in the context of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions.

original: 'di ni dgra bcom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i dus ma gtogs par dus thams cad du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra bcom pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i dus ma gtogs par dus thams cad du 'byung ngo //
translated: It occurs at all times except when the arhat, when one has attained the supramundane path, and when one is abiding in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gcig pu sogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags gcig pu sogs so //
translated: The afflicted mind and the neutral mental factors have only the imprints of natural outflow.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi yin pas kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gzhi yin pas kun gzhi'o //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the foundation of the seeds of all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena, and thus it is called the foundation.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na de la chos thams cad dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na de la chos thams cad dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel ba'am /
translated: In one sense, all phenomena are present in it as effects, and they are related to it as causes.

original: de chos thams cad la rgyu'i dngos par 'jug cing 'brel bas na kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: de chos thams cad la rgyu'i dngos par 'jug cing 'brel bas na kun gzhi'o //
translated: It is the foundation of all phenomena because it is the cause of all phenomena and is related to them.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness because it is the nature of consciousness.

original: kun gzhi ni ming gcig tu na sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi ni ming gcig tu na sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness is also called mind in one sense.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bag chags sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bag chags sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called mind because it is the storehouse of the imprints of virtue, nonvirtue, and the ethically neutral.

original: yang gcig tu na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called appropriating consciousness.

original: sems can gyi ris gang dang gang gi lus mngon par 'grub cing skye ba na /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris gang dang gang gi lus mngon par 'grub cing skye ba na /
translated: When the body of any class of sentient being is formed and born,🔽it is called appropriating because it appropriates the physical sense faculties together with the body and it appropriates the name.

original: lus dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can nye bar len pa dang / ming nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya ste 'dod pa dang gzugs yod pa'i khams na ni gnyi ga lan to //
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can nye bar len pa dang / ming nye bar len pa'i phyir nye bar len pa zhes bya ste 'dod pa dang gzugs yod pa'i khams na ni gnyi ga lan to //
translated: In the desire and form realms, both are appropriated.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ming bzhi 'ba' zhig len to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ming bzhi 'ba' zhig len to //
translated: In the formless realm, only the four name aggregates are appropriated.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yod par lung dang rigs pas mngon te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yod par lung dang rigs pas mngon te /
translated: That the appropriating consciousness exists is clearly known through scripture and reasoning.

original: lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ;
analyzed: lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ;
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab //🔽bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: all seeds spring forth like the flow of a river.🔽If I taught this to the naïve,

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: they would imagine it to be a self.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa las /
translated: And the Abhidharma of the Mahāyāna says:

original: thog ma med pa'ang dus kyi @224a * //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'ang dus kyi @224a * //
translated: The beginningless realm is

original: dbyings // chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: dbyings // chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: the foundation of all phenomena.🔽Because it exists, all transmigrating beings

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and even the attainment of nirvāṇa are possible.

original: rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'khor bar mi rung ste 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon bag chags kyi gzhi med pas 'khor bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rigs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'khor bar mi rung ste 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon bag chags kyi gzhi med pas 'khor bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The reasoning is as follows. Without the foundation consciousness, cyclic existence would not be possible, because without a basis for the habitual propensities that are the seeds of cyclic existence, cyclic existence would not be possible.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang kun gzhi med na mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang kun gzhi med na mi rung ste /
translated: Also, the elimination of the afflictions would not be possible without the foundation consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung du mi rung bas /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung du mi rung bas /
translated: The incompatible factors and the antidote cannot occur simultaneously in the consciousness that is engaged.

original: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa spang zhes byar ni rnal 'byor pa lam la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur mi srid /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa spang zhes byar ni rnal 'byor pa lam la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur mi srid /
translated: If it is said that manifest afflictions are eliminated, it is impossible for the afflictions to manifest when a practitioner is absorbed in the path.

original: sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi tshe na spang zhes byar ni gang na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de gnyen pos spangs dgos na /
analyzed: sa bon gyi gnas skabs kyi tshe na spang zhes byar ni gang na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de gnyen pos spangs dgos na /
translated: If it is said that the afflictions are eliminated when they are in the state of seeds, then the antidote must eliminate the seeds of the afflictions wherever they are.

original: gnyen po ma gtogs par sa bon gyi gnas gzhan med pas de spang du yang mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: gnyen po ma gtogs par sa bon gyi gnas gzhan med pas de spang du yang mi rung ngo ;
translated: But since there is no place for the seeds except in the antidote, it is also impossible to eliminate them.

original: / de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nyon mongs pa sbang du mi rung bas /
analyzed: / de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nyon mongs pa sbang du mi rung bas /
translated: Thus, if there is no foundation consciousness, it is impossible to eliminate the afflictions.

original: 'khor ba las ldog pa mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba las ldog pa mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would also be impossible to attain nirvana, which is the cessation of samsara.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na kun gzhi med du zin na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na kun gzhi med du zin na /
translated: Or, if you maintain that there is no foundation consciousness,

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang ; 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gags te med pas /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang ; 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gags te med pas /
translated: At the time of the meditative attainment of nonperception and the meditative attainment of cessation, all operative consciousnesses have ceased and do not exist.

original: de las langs pa'i tshe ci la brten nas 'byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las langs pa'i tshe ci la brten nas 'byung zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, when one arises from those meditative attainments, on what basis do they occur?

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par mngon no //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of foundation consciousness is clearly proven.

original: de sems las byung ba du zhig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de sems las byung ba du zhig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many mental factors are associated with it?

original: kun du 'gro ba lnga dang ldan no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba lnga dang ldan no //
translated: It is associated with five omnipresent mental factors.

original: tshor ba gsum gyi nang nas ni tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum gyi nang nas ni tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan te /
translated: From among the three feelings, it is associated with neutral feeling.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lung ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lung ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Foundation consciousness is neutral,

original: tshor ba gnyis ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gnyis ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gi rgyu yin te /
translated: but the two feelings of pleasure and pain are the causes of attachment and aversion.

original: rnam par smin pa bskyed nus pas kun gzhi dang ldan du mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: rnam par smin pa bskyed nus pas kun gzhi dang ldan du mi rung ngo ;
translated: It is not suitable for them to be associated with foundation consciousness, because they are capable of producing karmic maturation.

original: / de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yin /
analyzed: / de la bde ba'i tshor ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yin /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is the karmic maturation of virtuous karma.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yin /🔽tshor ba btang snyoms ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yin / tshor ba btang snyoms ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung bas /
translated: The feeling of pain is the karmic maturation of nonvirtuous karma.🔽The feeling of equanimity is the karmic maturation of both virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam @224b par smin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms nyid rnam par smin pa yin te /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam @224b par smin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba btang snyoms nyid rnam par smin pa yin te /
translated: Thus the karmic maturation of both virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is the feeling of equanimity that is concomitant with the foundation consciousness.

original: gnyis ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes btags so //
analyzed: gnyis ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes btags so //
translated: Both are designated as karmic maturation because they arise from karmic maturation.

original: kun gzhi dmigs pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni phra ste mi mngon pas /
analyzed: kun gzhi dmigs pa dang rnam par gcod pa ni phra ste mi mngon pas /
translated: The focal object and aspect of the foundation consciousness are subtle and not evident.

original: gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su ma chad pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su ma chad pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is not realized by others, it is called the unapprehendable focal object and the unapprehendable aspect.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyi snang ba byung na /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyi snang ba byung na /
translated: For example, when the light of the sun shines,

original: zla ba dang skar ma'i 'od yod bzhin du mi mngon pa ltar rnam par rtog pa rags pa'i dbang gis phra ba mi rtogs so //
analyzed: zla ba dang skar ma'i 'od yod bzhin du mi mngon pa ltar rnam par rtog pa rags pa'i dbang gis phra ba mi rtogs so //
translated: Just as the light of the moon and stars is not perceived when the sun shines, so the subtle is not perceived because of the power of gross discursive thought.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa bzhis ma bsgribs la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa bzhis ma bsgribs la /
translated: The level of the defiled mind is not obscured by the four afflictions.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin te rnam par smin pa de las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi 'byung /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin te rnam par smin pa de las rnam par smin pa gzhan mi 'byung /
translated: It is the nature of karmic ripening, and from that ripening no other ripening occurs.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous, it is called “unobscured and undefined.”

original: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o ;
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o ;
translated: The two truths are the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: / de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mthong bar bya ba mi rtogs te /
analyzed: / de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mthong bar bya ba mi rtogs te /
translated: In this regard, the conventional truth is not perceived by a conceptual consciousness to be the suchness of phenomena, which is to be seen.🔽It is also called “obscured by the obscurations.”

original: sgrib pas yang dag bsgribs zhes kyang bya rnam pa gcig tu na chos thams cad rang bzhin med cing stong pa las /
analyzed: sgrib pas yang dag bsgribs zhes kyang bya rnam pa gcig tu na chos thams cad rang bzhin med cing stong pa las /
translated: In one sense, all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature and empty.

original: phyin ci log gi dngos po skye zhing 'byung par mthong ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang grags pa tsam du bden pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi dngos po skye zhing 'byung par mthong ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang grags pa tsam du bden pa ste /
translated: The arising and occurrence of things that are erroneous are true in the mere conventions and renown of the world.

original: kun gyis shes pa la bya bar dbu ma'i bstan bcos las kyang bshad do //
analyzed: kun gyis shes pa la bya bar dbu ma'i bstan bcos las kyang bshad do //
translated: It is explained in the treatises of the Middle Way that they are known by everyone.

original: blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang ji snyed du tshig 'bru dang yi ges bstan pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa'i nang nas kyang ji snyed du tshig 'bru dang yi ges bstan pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Also, in the Akṣayamatisūtra and so on, it says, “All that is taught by syllables and letters is relative truth.”

original: mdor na dngos po rnams brtag mi bzod de rang bzhin med kyang 'phral du bya ba byed nus par snang ste /
analyzed: mdor na dngos po rnams brtag mi bzod de rang bzhin med kyang 'phral du bya ba byed nus par snang ste /
translated: In brief, things cannot withstand analysis, and although they are essenceless, they appear to be able to perform functions.

original: de tsam du bden pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam du bden pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by relative truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid mi 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid mi 'gag pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the unimpeded dharmatā of phenomena.

original: de don kyang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de don kyang yin la dam pa yang yin pas don dam pa'o //
translated: Since it is the meaning and it is also the highest, it is the ultimate.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dam pa'i don du bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dam pa'i don du bshad do //
translated: In one sense, it is explained as the meaning of the highest.

original: dngos po med par rtogs pa'i ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas dam pa'i don te /
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs pa'i ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas dam pa'i don te /
translated: Since it is the object of the sublime wisdom that realizes the absence of entities, it is the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa chos kyi de kho na nyid gzigs pa rnams la de ltar bden pas na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //🔽bdag med @225a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kyi de kho na nyid gzigs pa rnams la de ltar bden pas na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o // bdag med @225a * //
translated: Since it is thus true for the noble ones who see the reality of phenomena, it is called the ultimate truth.

original: pa rnam pa gnyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: pa rnam pa gnyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la gang zag la bdag med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang zag la bdag med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the selflessness of persons?

original: gang zag ces bya ba ni blo gros ngan pa log par rtog pa rnams kyis lus kyi khong na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag ces bya ba /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba ni blo gros ngan pa log par rtog pa rnams kyis lus kyi khong na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag ces bya ba /
translated: The so-called person is imagined by those with poor understanding and wrong ideas to be a person who is the agent within the body, called the self.

original: byed pa po dang zab po rtag pa gcig pu zhig yod par brtags nas /
analyzed: byed pa po dang zab po rtag pa gcig pu zhig yod par brtags nas /
translated: Imagining that there is a single, permanent creator and experiencer,

original: sems can dang srog dang gang zag la sogs pa'i sgrar 'dogs te /
analyzed: sems can dang srog dang gang zag la sogs pa'i sgrar 'dogs te /
translated: they impute the terms sentient being, life force, and person.

original: bdag rtag pa gcig pu zhig yod pas /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa gcig pu zhig yod pas /
translated: Since there is a single, permanent self,

original: las gang gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yang des myong ngo //
analyzed: las gang gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yang des myong ngo //
translated: the result of whatever action is done is also experienced by it.

original: gang bcings pa des 'grol lo //
analyzed: gang bcings pa des 'grol lo //
translated: That which is bound is also liberated.

original: gang gis sngon mthong ba des so sor ngo shes so //
analyzed: gang gis sngon mthong ba des so sor ngo shes so //
translated: The one who saw it in the past remembers it.

original: gang gis gzhag pa des dran no //
analyzed: gang gis gzhag pa des dran no //
translated: The one who placed it remembers it.

original: gal te bdag rtag pa med de skad cig ma yin du zin na /🔽byed pa yang gzhan za ba yang gzhan pas /
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag pa med de skad cig ma yin du zin na / byed pa yang gzhan za ba yang gzhan pas /
translated: If the self is not permanent, but momentary,

original: gzhan gyis byas la gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas la gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: then the one who acts is one, and the one who experiences is another.

original: gzhan bcings la gzhan grol ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan bcings la gzhan grol ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: One would be bound, and another would be liberated.

original: de lta bas na bdag rtag pa gcig pu yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag rtag pa gcig pu yod par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the self is permanent and unitary.

original: de ni de ltar mi rung ste rtag pa ni mi 'gyur bas byed pa po dang zab po chos mi mthun pa gnyis su 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rung ste rtag pa ni mi 'gyur bas byed pa po dang zab po chos mi mthun pa gnyis su 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: This is not tenable, because if it is permanent, it is not reasonable that it be a creator, since it would be contradictory for it to be both permanent and a creator.

original: rtag pa gcig pu yin pas gang gis bcings pa de nyid grol la zhes byar yang /
analyzed: rtag pa gcig pu yin pas gang gis bcings pa de nyid grol la zhes byar yang /
translated: If it is permanent and unitary, then the one who is bound is the one who is liberated.

original: gong ma lta bu'i skyon yod kyi steng du sems can thams cad ni mi rtag par mngon sum du snang la /
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i skyon yod kyi steng du sems can thams cad ni mi rtag par mngon sum du snang la /
translated: This is not tenable, because in addition to the previously mentioned errors, all sentient beings are directly perceived to be impermanent.

original: rtag pa gcig pu ni sus kyang ma mthong bas mngon sum dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rtag pa gcig pu ni sus kyang ma mthong bas mngon sum dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: Since no one has ever seen a permanent, unitary self, this contradicts direct perception.

original: ngo shes pa dang dran pa de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa dang dran pa de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to recognition and memory.

original: de lta bas na gang zag ces bya ba phung po lnga dang tha dad pa'i rtag pa gcig pu med pas gang zag la bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zag ces bya ba phung po lnga dang tha dad pa'i rtag pa gcig pu med pas gang zag la bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
