translated: Therefore, since there is no permanent, unitary self that is different from the five aggregates, it is said that the person is selfless.

original: ci ste bdag rtag pa gcig pu de kho na phung po lnga las gzhan ma yin na ni phung po bzhin du skad cig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste bdag rtag pa gcig pu de kho na phung po lnga las gzhan ma yin na ni phung po bzhin du skad cig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that permanent, unitary self were not different from the five aggregates, it would be momentary like the aggregates.

original: yang na phung po yang bdag bzhin du rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na phung po yang bdag bzhin du rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, the aggregates would be permanent like the self.

original: phung po bzhin du tha dad du mar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: phung po bzhin du tha dad du mar 'gyur bas /
translated: They would be multiple like the aggregates.

original: gcig pu mi rung ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig pu mi rung ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
translated: The error of being multiple would ensue, and it would not be unitary.

original: de ltar na gang zag la bdag med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag la bdag med do //
translated: Thus, the person is selfless.

original: chos la bdag med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the selflessness of phenomena?

original: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams te /
translated: Phenomena are the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / gzugs yod pa dang gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / gzugs yod pa dang gzugs med pa'o //
translated: In brief, they are conditioned and unconditioned, and with form and without form.

original: 'di @225b rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du ma grub pas rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di @225b rnams kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du ma grub pas rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: They are also without own-nature, because they are not established as having the nature of one or many.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs rnams dngos po gcig tu gyur na ni gcig pu la cha med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs rnams dngos po gcig tu gyur na ni gcig pu la cha med pa'i phyir /
translated: If forms were one entity, then because of being one without parts,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang zin pa dang ma zin pa dang / g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag kyang med cing /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dang zin pa dang ma zin pa dang / g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag kyang med cing /
translated: there would be no distinctions such as seeing and not seeing, being grasped and not being grasped, being covered and not being covered, and so on.

original: gom pa gcig gis kyang phyogs thams cad du son pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis kyang phyogs thams cad du son pa'i rigs so //
translated: It would follow that one step would reach everywhere.

original: ci ste cha shas yod par 'dod na ni cha shas kyis bshig na dngos po gcig tu mi 'grub po //
analyzed: ci ste cha shas yod par 'dod na ni cha shas kyis bshig na dngos po gcig tu mi 'grub po //
translated: But if you assert that there are parts, then because of being destroyed by the parts, they are not established as one entity.

original: rdul phra mo cha med pa yod ces bya bar yang /
analyzed: rdul phra mo cha med pa yod ces bya bar yang /
translated: It is also said that there are partless subtle particles.

original: ji tsam du rdul phra mo yod pa de tsam du lus yod de /
analyzed: ji tsam du rdul phra mo yod pa de tsam du lus yod de /
translated: To the extent that there are subtle particles, to that extent there is a body.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i go mi 'byed pas cha shas yod de gcig tu mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i go mi 'byed pas cha shas yod de gcig tu mi 'grub po //
translated: Since it does not allow the arising of another in its own place, it has parts and is not established as one.

original: gcig mi 'grub na de bsags pa'i dus yang med de /
analyzed: gcig mi 'grub na de bsags pa'i dus yang med de /
translated: If it is not established as one, then it is not established as a collection of those.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas dngos po med do //
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas dngos po med do //
translated: Since it is devoid of the nature of those two, it is not a thing.

original: gzugs med pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang gcig na ni rang bzhin mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang gcig na ni rang bzhin mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Also, the formless mind and mental factors, if they are one, do not change their nature.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po yang 'gyur du mi rung la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po yang 'gyur du mi rung la /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable for them to be virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on, in many ways.

original: skad cig pa thams cad kyang skad cig gcig pur 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig pa thams cad kyang skad cig gcig pur 'gyur te /
translated: Also, all that is momentary would be a single moment.

original: dus gsum thams cad kyang skad cig gcig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad kyang skad cig gcig tu zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: All three times would be exhausted in a single moment.

original: ci ste cha yod par 'dod na ni skad cig gi chas bshig na don dam par dngos por mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ci ste cha yod par 'dod na ni skad cig gi chas bshig na don dam par dngos por mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you assert that it has parts, then when it is destroyed by the parts of a moment, it is not established as a thing ultimately.

original: de ltar gcig tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gcig tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not suitable as one.

original: gcig ma grub pas du mar yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gcig ma grub pas du mar yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since it is not established as one, it is not established as many.

original: de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin dang bral bas dngos po med do //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin dang bral bas dngos po med do //
translated: Since it is devoid of the nature of both, it is not a real entity.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na byas thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na byas thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: In another way, all that is produced is dependently arisen.

original: gang dag bdag nyid grub pa med kyi rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas 'byung ba de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pas rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: gang dag bdag nyid grub pa med kyi rgyu dang rkyen la ltos nas 'byung ba de dag ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pas rang bzhin med do //
translated: Since those that do not exist by their own power but arise in dependence on causes and conditions are like an illusion, they are without intrinsic nature.

original: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang dngos po yod pa zhig yin na ni gcig tu du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas skyon bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang dngos po yod pa zhig yin na ni gcig tu du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas skyon bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even with respect to the unconditioned, such as space, if there were an existent entity, it would be difficult to avoid the error that it would be of the nature of many, since it is one.

original: de bas na chos thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are not established as being of the nature of one or many.

original: dngos po med pas chos la bdag med pa zhes bya'o //🔽mtshan nyid gsum ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pas chos la bdag med pa zhes bya'o // mtshan nyid gsum ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since they are not real entities, it is said that phenomena are without a self.🔽The three natures are the imagined nature, the dependent nature, and the perfected nature.

original: de la kun brtags @226a * //
analyzed: de la kun brtags @226a * //
translated: Among them, the imagined nature is the object of the conception of what is unreal.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: The characteristic of the dependent is that it is a nature or

original: bye brag tu ming gi brdar btags pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu ming gi brdar btags pa ste /
translated: a particular that is designated by nominal convention.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rang bzhin med pa sgyu ma tsam du snang ba la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rang bzhin med pa sgyu ma tsam du snang ba la /
translated: In dependent origination, which is mere illusion and devoid of intrinsic nature,

original: dngos po sna tshogs su mngon par zhen nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i chos nan gyis btags pa rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po sna tshogs su mngon par zhen nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i chos nan gyis btags pa rnams so //
translated: one is attached to the various things that appear, and one strongly imputes phenomena that are subject and object.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni gzugs /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni gzugs /
translated: Among these, the nature is such things as form,🔽feeling,

original: tshor ba / 'du shes /
analyzed: tshor ba / 'du shes /
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: bye brag ni gzugs rtag go //
analyzed: bye brag ni gzugs rtag go //
translated: The particulars are such things as “Form is permanent,”

original: gzugs mi rtag go //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag go //
translated: “Form is impermanent,”

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: “Form is afflicted,”

original: gzugs rnam par byang pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par byang pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and “Form is purified.”

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni rang mi 'byung gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis 'byung bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni rang mi 'byung gi rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis 'byung bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: The characteristic of the dependent is the phenomena of dependent origination, which do not arise by themselves but arise through the power of other causes and conditions.

original: phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad la bya mod kyi /
analyzed: phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad la bya mod kyi /
translated: It is applied to all outer and inner dependently arisen things.

original: dngos su na sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos snga ma snga ma la brten te phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su na sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos snga ma snga ma la brten te phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: But in fact, it is applied to the arising of later and later mental and mental-event phenomena in dependence on earlier and earlier ones.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid dang lam mo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid dang lam mo //
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is suchness, nirvana, and the path.

original: de la de bzhin nyid ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste lam gyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste lam gyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Among them, suchness is the intrinsic nature of phenomena, uncompounded, free from apprehendeds and apprehenders, and the object of observation of the path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni shin tu dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni shin tu dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Nirvana is the characteristic of the transformation of suchness that is utterly stainless.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag nas skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba 'dus byas kyi gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag nas skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba 'dus byas kyi gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: It is free from arising and disintegration, and is not harmed by compounded phenomena.

original: lam gyis thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyis thob par bya ba'o //
translated: It is what is to be attained by the path.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: These two are uncompounded.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is unchanging, it is called the perfected nature of the unchangeable.

original: lam ni 'dus byas te des yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam ni 'dus byas te des yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path is conditioned, and because it is realized by that, it is called the perfected nature of the unerring.

original: mdor na yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: mdor na yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: In brief, the perfected characteristic is the thusness of all things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yang dag par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / yang dag par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i stobs kyis rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is realized by bodhisattvas through the power of their diligence and the power of their correct attention.

original: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang /
analyzed: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang /
translated: And it is perfected by the perfection of the cultivation of that realization.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa'o //🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rgyu dang bcas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa'o // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni rgyu dang bcas /
translated: And it is perfected up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: @226b rkyen dang bcas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: @226b rkyen dang bcas pa la bya ste /
translated: Dependent origination is to be understood as having causes and conditions.

original: rgyu med / rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med / rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not without causes and conditions.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: phyi dang nang gi'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi'o //
translated: external and internal.

original: phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyi'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: External dependent origination is also twofold:

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: the connection with causes and the connection with conditions.

original: de la rgyu dang 'brel ba ni sa bon las myu gu 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'brel ba ni sa bon las myu gu 'byung ba nas /
translated: The connection with causes is from the seed arising as the sprout

original: ma tog las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ma tog las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the flower arising as the fruit.

original: rkyen dang 'brel ba ni khams drug 'dus pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen dang 'brel ba ni khams drug 'dus pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba ste /
translated: The connection with conditions is the arising of the fruit from the gathering of the six elements:

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / dus kyi khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / dus kyi khams so //
translated: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the time element.

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Internal dependent origination is also twofold:

original: lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: in the forward order and in the reverse order.

original: lugs su 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lugs su 'byung ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The forward order is also twofold:

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: the connection with causes and the connection with conditions.

original: de la rgyu dang 'brel ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'brel ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: The connection with causes is: because this exists, that arises;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: because this has arisen, that arises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: With ignorance as condition, there are volitions,

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: and so on up to: with birth as condition, there is old age and death, grief, lamentation, suffering, sorrow, and turmoil.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus there is the arising of this whole great mass of suffering.

original: de la ma rig pa ni las legs nyes dang / de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i don mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni las legs nyes dang / de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i don mi shes pa'o //
translated: Here, ignorance is not knowing the distinction between good and bad actions, and not knowing the truth.

original: 'du byed ni las legs nyes byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni las legs nyes byed pa'o //
translated: Volitions are the performance of good and bad actions.

original: rnam par shes pa ni las bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i thog mar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni las bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i thog mar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is the beginning of the life-stream of the store-consciousness perfumed by action.

original: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lngar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lngar gyur pa'o //
translated: Name-and-form is the five aggregates.

original: skye mched drug ni dbang po rnams dod pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni dbang po rnams dod pa'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the development of the faculties.

original: reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Contact is the complete definition of the object through the union of the three.

original: tshor ba ni reg pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum myong ba'o //🔽sred pa ni tshor ba la zhen cing mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni reg pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum myong ba'o // sred pa ni tshor ba la zhen cing mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of the three kinds of contact.🔽Craving is the desire for the object of feeling.

original: len pa ni sred pas g-yen spyos nas 'dzin zhing yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: len pa ni sred pas g-yen spyos nas 'dzin zhing yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Clinging is the grasping of craving with the desire for the object of feeling.

original: srid pa ni len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Becoming is the karma that is accumulated by clinging.

original: skye ba ni srid pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni srid pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
translated: Birth is the establishment of the result that is in conformity with becoming.

original: rga shi ni phung po smin pa dang phung po 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: rga shi ni phung po smin pa dang phung po 'jig pa'o //
translated: Aging and death is the ripening of the aggregates and the destruction of the aggregates.

original: mya ngan ni mi dga' ba'o //🔽smre sngags 'don pa @227a * //
analyzed: mya ngan ni mi dga' ba'o // smre sngags 'don pa @227a * //
translated: Sorrow is the unhappiness.

original: ni mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: ni mya ngan las byung ba'i tshig tu smra ba'o //
translated: Lamentation is the speech that arises from sorrow.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni lus la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni lus la gnod pa'o //
translated: Suffering is the harm to the body.

original: 'ba' zhig po ni bdag gi med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig po ni bdag gi med pa'o //
translated: Distress is the lack of self.

original: bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni bya ba gnyis gnyis su nye bar gnas te ma rig pa ni sems can rmongs par yang byed do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni bya ba gnyis gnyis su nye bar gnas te ma rig pa ni sems can rmongs par yang byed do //
translated: These twelve are established in two actions each. Ignorance causes the delusion of beings.

original: 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause of the establishment of the formative forces.

original: 'du byed ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par yang byed do //
translated: It also causes the formation of future results.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the establishment of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni srid pa'i nyid mtshams kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni srid pa'i nyid mtshams kyang sbyar ro //
translated: Consciousness also establishes the continuity of existence.

original: ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu 'byin to //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the establishment of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs ni phan tshun ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni phan tshun ston par yang byed do //
translated: Name-and-form also mutually support each other.

original: skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the establishment of the six sense bases.

original: skye mched drug ni rang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston to //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni rang gi yul rnam par phye ba yang ston to //
translated: The six sense bases also reveal the division of their own objects.

original: reg pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: reg pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the establishment of contact.

original: reg pa ni dmigs pa la reg par yang byed do //
analyzed: reg pa ni dmigs pa la reg par yang byed do //
translated: Contact also causes contact with the object.

original: tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: tshor ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the establishment of feeling.

original: tshor ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyis ka ma yin pa myong bar yang byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang gnyis ka ma yin pa myong bar yang byed do //
translated: Feeling also causes the experience of what is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither of the two.

original: sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: sred pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of craving.

original: sred pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la mngon par chags par yang byed do //
analyzed: sred pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la mngon par chags par yang byed do //
translated: Craving causes one to be attached to things that arouse desire.

original: len pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: len pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of grasping.

original: len pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching bar byang byed do //
analyzed: len pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pas 'ching bar byang byed do //
translated: Grasping causes one to be bound by the afflictions.

original: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of becoming.

original: srid pa ni srid pa'i rgyud gzhan du gnas par yang byed do //
analyzed: srid pa ni srid pa'i rgyud gzhan du gnas par yang byed do //
translated: Becoming causes one to remain in another life.

original: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of birth.

original: skye ba ni phung po 'byung bar yang byed do //
analyzed: skye ba ni phung po 'byung bar yang byed do //
translated: Birth causes the aggregates to arise.

original: rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: rga ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause for the actualization of aging.

original: rga ba ni dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed do //🔽'chi ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: rga ba ni dbang po yongs su 'gyur bar yang byed do // 'chi ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: Aging causes the faculties to change.🔽It also produces the cause for the actualization of death.

original: 'chi ba ni 'du byed 'jig par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni 'du byed 'jig par yang byed do //
translated: Death causes the conditioned to disintegrate.

original: yongs su ma shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yang 'byin to //
translated: It also produces the cause of the uninterrupted continuity of the non-understanding.

original: chos bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni yan lag lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni yan lag lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: These twelve factors are included in five categories.

original: dang po gsum ni 'phen pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: dang po gsum ni 'phen pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The first three are the projecting factors.

original: de'i 'og ma bzhi ni 'phangs pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma bzhi ni 'phangs pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The next four are the projected factors.

original: de'i 'og ma gsum ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gsum ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The next three are the actualizing factors.

original: skye ba ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: skye ba ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Birth is the actualized factor.

original: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go //
translated: Aging and death are the disadvantageous factors.

original: ji ltar 'phen @227b zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'phen @227b zhe na ;
translated: How are they projected?

original: ma rig pa yod pas legs nyes byed cing las kyi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod pas legs nyes byed cing las kyi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos nas /
translated: When there is ignorance, one performs good and bad actions, and the latent impressions are deposited on the consciousness of action.

original: de gsum gyis ni mar skye ba 'phangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni mar skye ba 'phangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these three, the next birth is projected.

original: de nas sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa las de bskul nas /
analyzed: de nas sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa las de bskul nas /
translated: Then, craving, grasping, and becoming impel that.

original: tshe mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The birth of the next life is actualized.

original: de nas lang tsho dang srog 'phangs pa 'jig pas nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas lang tsho dang srog 'phangs pa 'jig pas nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, because of the destruction of the projection of youth and life, there is the disadvantage.

original: yang 'di dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / tshe dang gsum 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'di dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / tshe dang gsum 'gyur te /
translated: These members are threefold: action, affliction, and life-­basis.

original: ma rig pa dang srid pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang srid pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Ignorance, craving, and grasping are afflictions.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las so //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las so //
translated: Formation and becoming are actions.

original: lhag ma bdun ni tshe ste sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni tshe ste sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The remaining seven members are life-­basis, and are also called suffering.

original: gsum las gnyis 'byung /
analyzed: gsum las gnyis 'byung /
translated: Two arise from three;

original: gnyis las bdun 'byung /
analyzed: gnyis las bdun 'byung /
translated: seven arise from two;

original: bdun las kyang gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdun las kyang gsum 'byung ste /
translated: and three arise from seven.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med cing nges pa med par yang 'khor ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med cing nges pa med par yang 'khor ro //
translated: Thus the wheel of existence revolves without beginning or end, and in an indefinite manner.

original: yang de dag rab gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: yang de dag rab gsum du dbye ste /
translated: Moreover, these members are divided into three periods.

original: dang po gnyis ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The first two are of the past.

original: bar pa brgyad ni da ltar gyi'o //
analyzed: bar pa brgyad ni da ltar gyi'o //
translated: The eight middle ones are of the present.

original: tha ma gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The last two are of the future.

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las te da ltar gyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las te da ltar gyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, ignorance and formation are the afflictions and actions of the past, and are the causes of the present.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Consciousness, name-­and-­form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are the results of the present.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa dang las te /
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa dang las te /
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming are the present defilements and actions.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: They are the cause of the future.

original: / skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: / skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Birth and old age and death are the future results.

original: rkyen dang 'brel ba ni khams drug 'dus pa las phung po 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen dang 'brel ba ni khams drug 'dus pa las phung po 'grub pa ste /
translated: The connection with conditions is the establishment of the aggregates from the union of the six elements.

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: They are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: de la sa'i khams ni lus kyi sra ba'o //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams ni lus kyi sra ba'o //
translated: Among them, the earth element is the solidity of the body.

original: chu'i khams ni lus sdud pa dang gsher ba'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni lus sdud pa dang gsher ba'o //
translated: The water element is the cohesion and fluidity of the body.

original: me'i khams ni lus kyi drod do //
analyzed: me'i khams ni lus kyi drod do //
translated: The fire element is the heat of the body.

original: rlung gi khams ni lus kyi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni lus kyi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The wind element is the motion of the body.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni lus kyi nang sbubs yod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni lus kyi nang sbubs yod pa'o //
translated: The space element is the space within the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The consciousness element is the five consciousnesses and the contaminated mental consciousness.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan pas ni mu stegs can rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'dod pa sel te /🔽rgyu yod pa las 'byung zhing rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa dang / 'pho ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras @228a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bstan pas ni mu stegs can rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'dod pa sel te / rgyu yod pa las 'byung zhing rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa dang / 'pho ba ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras @228a * //
translated: The teaching of dependent origination eliminates the belief in arising from non-causes, which is the belief of the heterodox, and the belief in arising from a cause that is not its own.

original: bu chen po 'byung ba dang / de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du 'byung bar ston to //
analyzed: bu chen po 'byung ba dang / de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du 'byung bar ston to //
translated: It teaches that arising is from an existent cause, and that it is not eternal, not annihilated, not transferred, and that a great result arises from a small cause, and that it arises in a homogeneous continuum.

original: ji ltar rtag pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not eternal?

original: 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'gag la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'gag la /
translated: The aggregates that are included in death cease,

original: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the aggregates that are included in birth arise.

original: ji ltar chad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not annihilated?

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po 'gag la /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po 'gag la /
translated: The aggregates that are included in the end of death cease,

original: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and at that time the aggregates that are included in birth arise, like the rising and falling of the two pans of a scale.

original: ji ltar 'pho ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'pho ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not a transmigration?

original: sems can gyi ris mi 'dra bar shi 'phos la gzhan du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris mi 'dra bar shi 'phos la gzhan du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the death of one class of sentient beings and the birth of another.

original: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
translated: How is it a small cause for a great result?

original: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a small action produces a great result.

original: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud 'byung zhe na /
translated: How is it a continuity of the same kind?

original: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one experiences the result of the action that one has done.

original: lugs su mi 'byung ba ni 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: lugs su mi 'byung ba ni 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag pa ste /
translated: The non-reverse order is that this ceases when that ceases.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas skye ba 'gags pas rga shi la sogs pa 'gag pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas skye ba 'gags pas rga shi la sogs pa 'gag pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Thus, when ignorance ceases, the formative forces cease, and so on up to: when birth ceases, old age and death cease.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas ci'ang med pa 'gyur ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas ci'ang med pa 'gyur ba'ang ma yin /
translated: When ignorance ceases, it is not the case that something becomes nothing.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is it the case that dependent origination ceases.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'gags nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'gags nas /
translated: Once the side of defilement has been stopped,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su 'gyur te ;
translated: the side of purification will occur.

original: dper na sman bcud kyis len bya bzos nas tshe thung ba dang nad rnams med par gyur nas /
analyzed: dper na sman bcud kyis len bya bzos nas tshe thung ba dang nad rnams med par gyur nas /
translated: For example, once the elixir has been prepared, a short life span and illnesses are eliminated,

original: tshe ring ba dang nad med pa rnyed par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang nad med pa rnyed par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: and a long life span and good health are obtained.

original: ma rig pa 'gags te rig pa byung nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags te rig pa byung nas /
translated: Likewise, once ignorance has been stopped and knowledge has arisen,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu grub pa dang / rig pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dang ; ye shes kyi tshogs chen po skong ba'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa nas sar 'phar ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la tshogs yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu grub pa dang / rig pa las byung ba'i bsod nams dang ; ye shes kyi tshogs chen po skong ba'i bye brag gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa nas sar 'phar ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la tshogs yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: the results of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are accomplished, and through the distinctions of the great accumulations of merit and wisdom that arise from knowledge, the bodhisattvas ascend from ground to ground, and on the buddha ground the accumulations are completely perfected.

original: bsgrub pa thams cad mthar phyin nas /
analyzed: bsgrub pa thams cad mthar phyin nas /
translated: Once all the practices have been completed,

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag brnyes te /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag brnyes te /
translated: all the perfect qualities are obtained.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don lhun gyis grub par mdzad cing /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don lhun gyis grub par mdzad cing /
translated: Until the end of saṃsāra, the benefit of all beings is spontaneously accomplished.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: He abides in non-abiding nirvana.

original: lta ba'i khyad par mkhan po ye shes sdes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lta ba'i khyad par mkhan po ye shes sdes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The Distinctions of Views composed by the preceptor Yeshé Dé is complete.
